,What is Trava Finance?,"Trava Finance is a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform focused on building a credit-based ecosystem on blockchain. It provides a decentralized lending marketplace, allowing users to:

column3: Create and manage their own lending pools with customizable parameters (like interest rates, collateral requirements, etc.)
Borrow and lend crypto assets using a wide range of collateral types.
Use credit scoring mechanisms to evaluate borrower reliability, offering more flexible and potentially undercollateralized loans.
Decentralized Lending Pools

column1: Unlike traditional DeFi platforms with centralized pool control, Trava lets users create their own pools and set policies that match their risk appetite.

column3: Credit Risk Assessment

column1: Trava uses credit scoring models, including on-chain data and AI analysis, to assess users‚Äô creditworthiness ‚Äî a relatively novel approach in DeFi.

column3: Multi-chain Support

column1: Originally launched on Binance Smart Chain (BSC), Trava also expands to other chains to support interoperability.

column3: Trava Token (TRAVA)

column1: The platform‚Äôs native token is used for:

column3: Governance (voting on proposals)
Incentives (rewards, staking)
Paying for services within the Trava ecosystem.
Marketplace Flexibility

column1: Lenders can choose which pools to join and tailor risk/return preferences, while borrowers get more customized loan options.

column3: Security & DAO Governance

column1: Trava emphasizes decentralized governance, allowing token holders to vote on important protocol decisions.

column3: Creating lending pools for specific communities or purposes.
Accessing capital without centralized intermediaries.
Leveraging a unique DeFi credit score to secure better borrowing conditions.

column1: You can explore the official documentation here: https://docs.trava.finance/portal

Would you like a comparison between Trava and other lending protocols like Aave or Compound?","Trava Finance is a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform built on blockchain technology, offering lending, borrowing, and asset management services. It is designed to be a flexible and customizable protocol, with a focus on community governance and risk management.

column3: Decentralized Lending Marketplace:
Users can create and manage their own lending pools.
Each pool can have customized parameters such as collateral ratios, interest rates, and supported tokens.
Risk Assessment Mechanism:
Trava integrates AI-driven risk assessment tools to evaluate creditworthiness and collateral risks, aiming to reduce the risk of defaults and liquidations.
NFT-based Collateral:
It supports NFTs as collateral in addition to regular crypto tokens, which is relatively novel in the DeFi space.
Multi-chain Deployment:
Trava Finance operates on multiple blockchain networks, such as BNB Chain (formerly BSC) and others, to increase accessibility and lower transaction fees.
Governance Token (TRAVA):
TRAVA is the platform‚Äôs native utility token used for governance, staking, and participating in the ecosystem.
Marketplace Analytics:
Offers tools for users to analyze pool performance, borrower behaviors, and risk profiles.
Borrowers can obtain loans using crypto or NFTs as collateral.
Lenders can earn interest by supplying assets to customizable lending pools.
Developers can use Trava‚Äôs infrastructure to build financial products with flexible lending rules.

","{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""# Trava Finance‚Äôs next moves facing the impacts
In a situation like this, there are many actions that a platform like Trava Finance can take to ensure its users‚Äô benefits. First of all, it must be clear that, because of the quick decisions of the leadership team, our ecosystem was fortunate to not suffer any serious consequences. And the next steps also need the same precision, as it will directly affect users in our ecosystem. Therefore, our team is reviewing all aspects of the situation, actively discussing to come up with a suitable solution. By taking the right steps early, Trava Finance can stay away from risks, seize the chance to succeed and stay ahead of the wave. # Conclusion
But most importantly, no matter what decision, it needs community consensus, as what Trava Finance always aims for is a completely decentralized finance environment. We want to hear your opinions, and will carefully consider each one, so that we can support the development of this ecosystem together. Ultimately, our future will depend on the broader crypto market, and the choice of the community ‚Äî that‚Äôs what DeFi is truly about.
**_About Trava.Finance_**
**Trava Finance is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending.**
While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters such as borrow/supply interest rate, liquidation threshold, Loan-to-Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, Trava Finance offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business.
Trava Finance is deployed on the Binance Smart Chain and allows for lending with BSC tokens first; we then enable cross-chain lending with various tokens on Ethereum and other blockchain networks.

,What does Trava offer?,"Trava Finance offers a comprehensive suite of decentralized finance (DeFi) products centered around lending, borrowing, credit scoring, and asset management. According to the official documentation, here‚Äôs a breakdown of what Trava offers:

column3: Users can borrow and lend crypto assets.
Unlike fixed protocols like Aave or Compound, Trava allows anyone to create their own lending pool.
Pool owners can customize parameters: interest rate models, collateral requirements, supported tokens, and liquidation policies.
Trava integrates credit scoring algorithms to evaluate user creditworthiness.
Scoring is based on:
On-chain behavior
DeFi activity history
Network reputation
Goal: Enable under-collateralized or credit-based lending in the future.
Initially on Binance Smart Chain (BSC), expanding to support cross-chain features.
A DeFi hub/dashboard for managing all Trava products:
Portfolio tracking
Risk metrics
Asset performance
Lending/borrowing activities
A marketplace for liquidating undercollateralized loans.
Third parties can participate in buying discounted assets during liquidations.
Trava integrates machine learning models to assess systemic risk and individual pool risk.
These tools support pool managers and lenders in making data-driven decisions.
The ecosystem is governed by the TRAVA token, which allows holders to:
Vote on protocol upgrades
Propose changes to the system
Participate in key decision-making
Governance
Rewards and incentives
Staking
Transaction fees in the ecosystem

column1: Would you like a visual summary or comparison with other platforms like Aave, Venus, or Compound?","Trava Finance offers a comprehensive decentralized finance (DeFi ecosystem), with a focus on lending, borrowing, risk management, and community-driven governance. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of what Trava offers:

column3: Unlike traditional DeFi platforms with a single global pool, Trava allows users to create and manage their own lending pools.
Pool creators can set:
Supported tokens
Collateral ratios
Interest rate models
Risk parameters
Trava enables users to borrow against NFTs as collateral.
NFT appraisals are powered by on-chain/off-chain mechanisms and risk assessment tools.
Supports use cases in GameFi and Metaverse where NFTs have tangible value.
Offers a risk management framework using AI and data analytics to evaluate:
User creditworthiness
Asset risk levels
Pool performance
Helps reduce defaults and improve lending safety.
A liquidity management and investment arm that analyzes DeFi protocols and invests in promising opportunities.
Offers lending and yield-generating strategies curated by experts.
Provides tools for analyzing NFT value trends, transaction history, rarity scoring, and floor prices.
Supports NFT lending marketplaces and valuation services.
Governance: Token holders vote on protocol upgrades and pool configurations.
Staking: Earn rewards for staking TRAVA tokens.
Incentives: Used in mining rewards and liquidity programs.
Primarily based on BNB Chain, but expanding to Ethereum, Polygon, and other EVM-compatible chains for wider accessibility and lower fees.
Fully embraces DAO principles, allowing users to vote on key decisions and shape the protocol‚Äôs future.

What does Trava do to avoid risk?
Risk can occur in smart contracts not only on BSC but also on other networks. To ensure the safe, we have several strategies as follows:
 * Auditing code performed by third parties: we have been audited by Hacken and Certik. We are contacting others.
 * Audit internally our code. We have a strong team with high-security skills.
 * Community check: we will organize hackathon events and reward programs that encourage the community to detect risks."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""## TRAVA Listing Annoucement"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/?source=post_page---author_recirc--06d59019f830----3---------------------d7db8cc5_2946_48e7_bb69_4dcb44b9d4e3--------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""### Trava Finance is a decentralized, transparent, and secured lending marketplace that offers users a flexible mechanism to create and manage‚Ä¶

,How to interconnect with Trava protocol?,"To interconnect with the Trava Finance protocol, developers and users can integrate through several key components provided in the official documentation. Here‚Äôs how:
Trava is fully decentralized and open, so you can interact directly with its smart contracts deployed on supported blockchains (primarily BNB Chain).

column3: You can call smart contracts to:
Supply assets
Borrow assets
Create or manage lending pools
Perform liquidations
ABI and contract addresses are usually available in the documentation or GitHub.

column1: Trava provides a Subgraph that indexes its on-chain data, making it easier to query data like:

column3: User balances
Pool configurations
Credit scores
Borrowing/lending history

column1: Useful for dApp builders or analytics dashboards.
While the documentation may not list a full SDK yet, Trava encourages using Web3 libraries like:

column3: ethers.js
web3.js
wagmi (for React-based dApps)

column1: To build frontends or automated tools around the Trava protocol.
Trava supports standard Web3 wallet connections (like MetaMask, WalletConnect, etc.) via:

column3: Web3Modal or custom integrations
Network must be switched to BNB Chain or supported chains

column1: Advanced users can interact with the pool creation process:

column3: Either via the Trava Station UI
Or by calling the PoolFactory smart contract to deploy custom pools with custom parameters.

column1: For dApps that want to read or incorporate Trava‚Äôs credit scores, the credit score data is accessible via:

column3: On-chain reads
Possibly the Subgraph (depending on implementation)
This enables integration of DeFi-native credit models into other protocols
Official portal: https://docs.trava.finance/portal
GitHub: https://github.com/TravaOpenPlatform
Subgraph explorer (The Graph): check for Trava‚Äôs endpoint via thegraph.com

column1: If you‚Äôre building a product or integration, would you like sample code (e.g. to lend/borrow via Web3), or guidance on a specific use case like creating your own lending pool or reading credit scores?","To interconnect with the Trava Finance protocol, you can engage at different levels depending on whether you are a user, developer, or integrator. Here‚Äôs how to do it:

column3: Smart contracts are publicly deployed on chains like BNB Chain (BSC).
You can interact with them via:
Web3.js / Ethers.js
Hardhat / Brownie for testing/deployment
Look for Trava‚Äôs contract addresses and ABIs on:
BscScan
Trava‚Äôs GitHub (if available)
Connect your app to BNB Chain via a Web3 provider (e.g., MetaMask).
Load the ABI + contract address of the specific Trava module:
Lending pool contract
NFT collateral contract
TRAVA token contract
Call smart contract functions for:
Supplying/withdrawing assets
Borrowing with collateral
Creating custom pools
Voting with TRAVA tokens

column1: Trava provides a modular infrastructure where you can build DeFi products on top of:

column3: Custom lending pools
Risk-assessment modules
NFT valuation tools

column1: You can integrate Trava‚Äôs components into your own UI and logic to offer:

column3: Peer-to-peer lending
NFT-collateral loans
DAO-governed fund management

column1: You can use Trava‚Äôs data analytics dashboard (available on their site) to:

column3: Monitor lending pool health
Assess borrower behavior
Analyze NFT price movements

column1: They also expose historical and on-chain data for deeper integration with custom dashboards or data pipelines.
If you manage a wallet app or DAO:

column3: Support staking and voting via Trava‚Äôs governance contracts.
Allow users to track rewards and interact with NFT-based lending directly from your platform.

column1: To interact as a regular user:

column3: Visit https://app.trava.finance
Connect your wallet (e.g., MetaMask, Trust Wallet).
Choose one of the actions:
Lend tokens and earn yield.
Borrow with crypto or NFT collateral.
Stake TRAVA tokens.
Participate in governance votes.",docs,"[{""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"",

Additionally, you can also borrow by using your deposited assets as collateral.","{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""##
Brief description of Trava
TRAVA is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters such as borrow/supply interest rate, liquidation threshold, Loan-to-Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, TRAVA offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. TRAVA also offers the credit score function based on financial data on-chain analysis as a useful tool that reduces risk and increases profits for all users.
We build our solutions on TRAVA.FINANCE whose smart contracts are deployed on BSC network, so the speed of transactions, gas fees, and robustness depend on BSC network. However, in the near future, we will allow cross-chain lending in our platform.
Please join the the Trava team and members of the community look forward to helping you understand and use Trava. ##
Why should we trust Trava?
Trava Protocol has been audited and secured internally, by third parties (Hacken, Certik) and even Community Checks.
Check https://docs.trava.finance/security/ for more information. ##
**How to interconnect with Trava protocol**?
In order to interconnect with Trava protocol, you need to deposit your asset into lending pools. After depositing, you will earn passive income, this income is based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, you can also borrow by using your deposited assets as collateral. ##
Do I need to pay fees to interconnect with Trava protocol?
Interacting with the protocol requires transactions and so transaction fees for BSC Blockchain usage, which depend on the network status and transaction complexity."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""Trava Governance module aims to bring the protocol to a new level of decentralization - Trava DAO. This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes & improvements as a way of participating in the protocol‚Äôs decision-making process.
In the big picture, there are four essential components in Trava Governance: the Trava community, the DAO Committee, the Security Advisory Board (SAB), and Governance Portal & smart contracts.
 * Trava community: The most valuable resource of ideas, discussions & feedback for protocol changes. Everyone can raise their voice & share their opinion on Trava Forum or any community social channels.
 * DAO Committee: The entrusted individuals in the Trava community to submit proposals after a thorough review with discussion & feedback.
 * Security Advisory Board: The guardian for the protocol‚Äôs security when some malicious actions are aimed at the protocol or in unexpected events.
 * Governance Portal & Smart contracts: The autonomous ‚ÄúHand of the King‚Äù consists of governance contracts for on-chain voting and multiple timelocks governing and automating the changes & updates of Trava Ecosystem‚Äôs smart contracts. That keeps the governance process public and transparent to everyone.


NextDAO

 * Trava community: The most valuable resource of ideas, discussions & feedback for protocol changes. Everyone can raise their voice & share their opinion on Trava Forum or any community social channels.

**Trava Document Portal**
TRAVA FINANCE is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. Different from existing approaches, we offer a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. TRAVA FINANCE also brings to you the credit score function based on financial data on-chain analysis, which is a useful tool to reduce risk and increase profits for all users. We have started integrating AI technology to our products with the ultimate goal of giving users the best experience on Web3 and with DeFi space.
We build our solutions on TRAVA.FINANCE whose smart contracts are deployed on the BSC network, so the speed of transactions, gas fees, and robustness depend on the BSC network. However, in the near future, we will allow cross-chain lending on our platform.
With the purpose to help users to understand the fundamentals of Trava Protocol, this Portal links to key resources on Trava. Please join our Channel to discuss with Trava community on , our team and community members are always willing to help you to build on top of Trava. ##
**FAQ**
Summary of Frequently Asked Questions about Trava Introduction and its key features. In this FAQ, we provide users with answers of that concerns in a catchy and brief manner. ##
**Community Telegram**
We would like to invite you to join the Trava community where all issues about Trava will be discussed and solved. ##
**Whitepaper**
The white paper is a report to briefly inform users about Trava protocol, complex issues, and Trava features. Please visit our white paper https://docs.trava.finance/ to have an overview of Trava.Finance."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance"", ""rrf_score"": 0.0625 } ] }",True,True,True,True,FALSE,False,,,,['https://docs.trava.finance/faq'],"['In order to interconnect with Trava protocol, you need to deposit your asset into lending pools. ,Do I need to pay fees to interconnect with Trava protocol?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, you do not need to pay any fees to integrate or interconnect with the Trava protocol itself ‚Äî it‚Äôs a permissionless, open DeFi platform built on blockchain. However, there are a few types of costs or fees you should be aware of depending on how you‚Äôre interacting:

column3: Developers and dApps can freely interact with Trava smart contracts.
No licensing, subscription, or API usage fees.
You can use Web3 libraries (e.g., ethers.js) or Subgraph without paying Trava directly.

column1: ‚ö†Ô∏è You Will Pay Blockchain Gas Fees

column3: Since Trava is deployed on BNB Chain (formerly Binance Smart Chain), every transaction (e.g., lending, borrowing, pool creation) requires a gas fee paid in BNB.
Typical actions that cost gas:
Supplying assets
Borrowing
Repaying loans
Creating a new lending pool
Voting in governance

column1: Some actions on Trava may include protocol-defined fees, which go to the protocol treasury or pool owners:

column3: Borrowing interest (paid to lenders)
Liquidation incentives (paid to liquidators)
Pool creation fee (might be required when launching your own pool)
Withdrawal fees (if defined by the pool manager)

column1: These are not integration fees, but rather economic mechanisms of the protocol.
üîê Example: Costs to Create a Custom Lending Pool

column3: Gas fee to deploy the pool
Possible protocol fee or deposit required depending on Trava‚Äôs governance settings
Notes
Free
Requires gas (BNB)
Gas + possible Trava fee
Free to use
Gas only

column1: Let me know if you want a breakdown of fees for a specific interaction, such as borrowing or creating a pool.","Yes, you may need to pay certain fees when interacting with the Trava Finance protocol, but it depends on the type of interaction. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of what you might pay for:

column3: Yes, you must pay gas fees for all on-chain transactions.
These are network fees, not fees taken by Trava.
Since Trava mainly runs on BNB Chain (BSC), gas fees are relatively low (usually <$0.10 USD per transaction).

column1: Trava may charge protocol-level fees on certain actions. These are built into the smart contracts.

column3: Interest Spread: When borrowing, a portion of the interest goes to lenders, and part may be kept by the protocol or pool creator.
Liquidation Fee: If a borrower‚Äôs position is liquidated, a fee may be taken from the collateral.
Pool Management Fees (for custom pools): Creators may set their own fee structure for using their pool.
No need to pay to access the protocol or API.
No subscription or monthly fee to use Trava.
Everything is open and on-chain ‚Äî you pay only for what you use.
Who Gets It?
Blockchain validators
Lenders & Trava protocol

""}]",https://docs.trava.finance/faq,"Interacting with the protocol requires transactions and so transaction fees for BSC Blockchain usage, which depend on the network status and transaction complexity.","{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""##
Brief description of Trava
TRAVA is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters such as borrow/supply interest rate, liquidation threshold, Loan-to-Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, TRAVA offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. TRAVA also offers the credit score function based on financial data on-chain analysis as a useful tool that reduces risk and increases profits for all users.
We build our solutions on TRAVA.FINANCE whose smart contracts are deployed on BSC network, so the speed of transactions, gas fees, and robustness depend on BSC network. However, in the near future, we will allow cross-chain lending in our platform.
Please join the the Trava team and members of the community look forward to helping you understand and use Trava. ##
Why should we trust Trava?
Trava Protocol has been audited and secured internally, by third parties (Hacken, Certik) and even Community Checks.
Check https://docs.trava.finance/security/ for more information. ##
**How to interconnect with Trava protocol**?
In order to interconnect with Trava protocol, you need to deposit your asset into lending pools. After depositing, you will earn passive income, this income is based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, you can also borrow by using your deposited assets as collateral. ##
Do I need to pay fees to interconnect with Trava protocol?
Interacting with the protocol requires transactions and so transaction fees for BSC Blockchain usage, which depend on the network status and transaction complexity."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""## Introduction To The rTRAVA Bridge

,Does Trava have a Mobile App?,"As of now, Trava Finance does not offer a dedicated mobile app (iOS or Android), according to the information in their official documentation.
üì± How to Use Trava on Mobile Devices
Even though there‚Äôs no native app, you can still access and use Trava‚Äôs features on mobile through:

column3: Mobile Web Browsers with Wallet Support
Use browsers like Brave, Opera, or Safari/Chrome on mobile.
Connect wallets like MetaMask Mobile, Trust Wallet, or WalletConnect.
Wallet DApp Browsers
Many crypto wallets (e.g., MetaMask, Trust Wallet, SafePal) have a built-in DApp browser.
You can enter https://station.trava.finance directly and interact with Trava Finance seamlessly.

column1: Trava‚Äôs main portal (Trava Station) and app interfaces are responsive and designed to work on mobile, allowing:

column3: Lending/borrowing
Viewing your portfolio
Managing pools
Staking TRAVA tokens
Governance voting

column1: Would you like a step-by-step guide on how to access Trava via MetaMask Mobile or Trust Wallet?","As of now, Trava Finance does not have a dedicated mobile app on platforms like iOS (App Store) or Android (Google Play).

column3: Built-in DApp browser

Enter Trava‚Äôs URL manually
Use the wallet for signing transactions

What does Trava do to avoid risk?
Risk can occur in smart contracts not only on BSC but also on other networks. To ensure the safe, we have several strategies as follows:
 * Auditing code performed by third parties: we have been audited by Hacken and Certik. We are contacting others.
 * Audit internally our code. We have a strong team with high-security skills.
 * Community check: we will organize hackathon events and reward programs that encourage the community to detect risks."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""Another flagship of Trava Finance is Trava Station, which serves as the core system. It is the central hub of our ecosystem, from which you can interact with and utilize other products such as Trava Lending, Staking, and Governance, as well as those of PancakeSwap. This product aims to help the entire dApp of Trava Finance enhance user convenience and efficiency.
To be more specific, Trava Station streamlines your experience by allowing you to combine multiple actions into a single transaction, eliminating the need to switch between dApps and platforms. This not only saves time but also reduces gas fees, making transactions faster and more cost-effective.
_The gas fees saved by using Trava Station are significant!_ You can check how much gas fees you can save in the picture and how you can aggregate multiple actions in one transaction below.
At present, Trava Station has 6 features:
‚û°Ô∏è Freight: Allows users to execute the sequence of actions according to their own demands.
‚û°Ô∏è Tramlines: Provides a list of pre-made shortcuts to do common actions.
‚û°Ô∏è Junction: Allow users to pre-set transactions to be auto-executed when the conditions are met.
‚û°Ô∏è Portfolio: A real-time report that keeps track of all your activities and assets in Trava Station.
‚û°Ô∏è Analytics: Get real-time analysis and personal suggestions based on your assets and preferences to help your decision-making. ‚û°Ô∏è Recommendations: Provide a thorough analysis and prediction of DEXs‚Äô parameters.
NextPortfolio

,How to deposit on Trava?,"To deposit on Trava Finance, you supply assets into a lending pool ‚Äî this is how you earn interest or participate as a lender. Here‚Äôs a step-by-step guide based on the official documentation:

column3: Web3 Wallet: MetaMask, Trust Wallet, WalletConnect-compatible wallet.
BNB Chain Network: Trava operates on the BNB Chain (formerly Binance Smart Chain). Ensure your wallet is connected to it.
BNB for Gas Fees: You‚Äôll need a small amount of BNB to pay for transaction fees.
Supported Assets: You must hold the asset you want to deposit (e.g., BUSD, USDT, ETH, etc.)

column1: ü™ô Step-by-Step: How to Deposit on Trava

column3: Visit: https://station.trava.finance
Click ‚ÄúConnect Wallet‚Äù (MetaMask, WalletConnect, etc.).
Ensure you‚Äôre on BNB Chain.
Browse available pools or choose the default lending pool.
Click on the asset you want to supply (e.g., BUSD, USDT).
A modal will open showing your available balance.
Enter the amount to deposit.
If it‚Äôs your first time depositing that asset, you‚Äôll be asked to approve the token.
Click ‚ÄúApprove‚Äù and confirm the transaction in your wallet.
This allows Trava‚Äôs smart contract to interact with your token.
After approval, click ‚ÄúSupply‚Äù.
Confirm the transaction in your wallet.
Once the transaction is confirmed on-chain, your deposit will appear under ‚ÄúYour Supply‚Äù.
You‚Äôll start earning interest based on the pool‚Äôs APY.
Your deposit earns interest automatically.
You can withdraw anytime.
You can use the deposited amount as collateral to borrow other assets.
Deposit limits and APY rates vary per pool and token.
Some pools are created by community members and may carry higher risk ‚Äî always review pool parameters before depositing.

column1: Would you like help choosing a pool or comparing deposit APYs across tokens?","To deposit on Trava Finance, you typically supply crypto assets into a lending pool to earn interest. Here‚Äôs a step-by-step guide to do it securely:

column3: Web3 Wallet:
Install and set up MetaMask or Trust Wallet
Connect to BNB Chain (BSC) or the relevant chain Trava is deployed on
Supported Tokens:
Have some BNB (for gas fees)
Hold supported tokens like USDT, BUSD, ETH, or others in your wallet
Open https://app.trava.finance
Connect your wallet (MetaMask, WalletConnect, etc.)
On the dashboard, select a lending market/pool
You can choose from default pools or user-created ones
Click on a supported token (e.g., USDT, BUSD)
Click ‚ÄúSupply‚Äù or ‚ÄúDeposit‚Äù
Input the amount you want to deposit
You‚Äôll see estimated interest and APY
Approve the token if it‚Äôs your first time depositing
Confirm the transaction in MetaMask
Wait for confirmation (a few seconds on BNB Chain)
Your funds are added to the lending pool
You start earning interest immediately
You‚Äôll receive Trava protocol tokens (like tUSDT) representing your supplied assets

column1: You can withdraw your deposit (and earned interest) anytime, unless it‚Äôs locked due to being borrowed. Go to the same pool and click ‚ÄúWithdraw‚Äù.

column2: To test and understand the flow
As with any DeFi, risk management is crucial

Retention rate
It will be calculated according to the ratio of TRAVA deposit to the amount of TRAVA circulating in the market. So when you deposit your TRAVA, all stakes will be snapshotted, ensuring your benefits are fixed at the moment of entry.
For example, if a user deposits 1 million TRAVA and the total amount of TRAVA in circulation at the moment is 1 billion, then the retention rate will be 0.1%."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/nfts/dilution-staking"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""## Task 4. 2 links ch·ª©a c√πng 1 n·ªôi dung,How much is Trava token allocation?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, the TRAVA token allocation is distributed across several categories to support ecosystem growth, community engagement, and project sustainability.
Here is a breakdown of the TRAVA token allocation:

column3: Ecosystem (25%): Supports development of products, partnerships, community grants, and protocol incentives.
Mining (30%): Used for liquidity mining, lending/borrowing incentives, staking rewards, and user engagement.
Team (15%): Allocated to core contributors; typically subject to vesting periods.
Advisors (5%): Strategic advisors helping guide the protocol‚Äôs direction.
Marketing (10%): For campaigns, influencer partnerships, airdrops, and user acquisition.
Private Sale (7.5%): Early investors and strategic funding rounds.
Public Sale (2.5%): Available during the IDO or public launch.
Liquidity (5%): Ensures token availability in DEX/CEX pairs for trading.

column1: Most allocations (especially team, advisors, and private sale) are vested over time to align long-term incentives and reduce sudden token dumps. Specific schedules may vary and are typically detailed in tokenomics or vesting contracts.

Let me know if you‚Äôd like a visual chart of this allocation or details about current circulating supply vs total supply.","The TRAVA token allocation refers to how the total supply of TRAVA tokens is distributed among different participants and purposes within the Trava Finance ecosystem. Here is the official allocation based on their whitepaper and tokenomics:

column3: Amount (TRAVA)

column4: Incentivize lending, borrowing, staking, and liquidity provision
Reserved for core team and advisors (vested over time)
Used for partnerships, community incentives, hackathons, etc.
Reserved for long-term development or emergency funding
Distributed via public fundraising rounds (e.g., IDO on launchpads)

column3: Team & Advisors: Typically under a vesting schedule (e.g., 12‚Äì24 months lock-up with monthly release).
Liquidity Mining: Gradually released via smart contract over several years.
Community & Ecosystem: Allocated based on proposal voting, campaigns, and milestones.
TRAVA is an inflationary utility token, mainly used for:
Governance voting
Staking and rewards
Fee discounts
Access to features (e.g., pool creation)

column1: Let me know if you‚Äôd like a visual pie chart of this allocation or a breakdown of the current circulating supply and price metrics.","docs, blog","[{""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/trava-tokenomics-for-a-strategic-vision-a8098eaac5af"",
We distribute tokenomics with a long-term vision and sustainability for the project.
As a DEFI community lending solution, Trava reverses the most tokens (40%) for Liquidity Mining.

Trava believes that Marketing is one of the important criteria for business development. The tokenomics for it will be used to help expand Trava‚Äôs awareness, position our products and services, and boost customer acquisition.

The foundation & team play an important role in Trava.Finance‚Äôs long-term and sustainable development plan. They will support the company‚Äôs operations, future partnerships and other corporate business requirements.
The remaining components are distributed with the goal of ensuring fairness to investors, enhancing the attractiveness of the project, and developing successful products.
Liquidity Mining ‚Äî 40.0%, Marketing ‚Äî 22.0%, Foundation ‚Äî 20%, Listing ‚Äî 2.0%, Team ‚Äî 10%, Advisors ‚Äî 6.0%.
We distribute tokenomics with a long-term vision and sustainability for the project.
As a DEFI community lending solution, Trava reverses the most tokens (40%) for Liquidity Mining.

Trava believes that Marketing is one of the important criteria for business development. The tokenomics for it will be used to help expand Trava‚Äôs awareness, position our products and services, and boost customer acquisition.

The native digital cryptographically-secured fungible token of TRAVA.FINANCE (Trava token) is a transferable representation of attributed governance and utility functions specified in the protocol/code of TRAVA.FINANCE, and which is designed to be used solely as an interoperable utility token on the platform. Trava token is issued based on Binance Smart Chain‚Äôs BEP20 standard.
Trava token is a functional utility token which will be used as the medium of exchange between participants on TRAVA.FINANCE in a decentralised manner. The goal of introducing Trava token is to provide a convenient and secure mode of payment and settlement between participants who interact within the ecosystem on TRAVA.FINANCE, and it is not, and not intended to be, a medium of exchange accepted by the public (or a section of the public) as payment for goods or services or for the discharge of a debt; nor is it designed or intended to be used by any person as payment for any goods or services whatsoever that are not exclusively provided by the issuer. Trava token does not in any way represent any shareholding, participation, right, title, or interest in the Company, the Distributor, their respective affiliates, or any other company, enterprise or undertaking, nor will Trava token entitle token holders to any promise of fees, dividends, revenue, profits or investment returns, and are not intended to constitute securities in Singapore or any relevant jurisdiction. Trava token may only be utilised on TRAVA.FINANCE, and ownership of Trava token carries no rights, express or implied, other than the right to use Trava token as a means to enable usage of and interaction within TRAVA.FINANCE.
Trava also provides the economic incentives which will be distributed to encourage users to contribute to and participate in the ecosystem on TRAVA.FINANCE, thereby creating a mutually beneficial system where every participant is fairly compensated for its efforts. Trava token is an integral and indispensable part of TRAVA.FINANCE, because without Trava token, there would be no incentive for users to expend resources to participate in activities or provide services for the benefit of the entire ecosystem on TRAVA.FINANCE. Given that additional Trava token will be awarded to a user based only on its actual usage, activity and contribution on TRAVA.FINANCE and/or proportionate to the frequency and volume of transactions, users of TRAVA.FINANCE and/or holders of Trava token which did not actively participate will not receive any Trava token incentives.
Trava token is used in 4 main areas: (1) Reward (2) Collateral & Lending (3) Payment (4) Staking:
 1. **Reward:** To incentivise users to provide liquidity to pools, pool owners can set up rewards paid in TRAVA token.
 2. **Collateral and lending:** TRAVA tokens may be used as the basic collateral for loans and mortgages.
 3. **Payment for lending fees:** As the native platform currency, TRAVA tokens may be used to pay for lending fees in TRAVA.FINANCE pools.
 4. **Payment for pool management:** As the native platform currency, TRAVA tokens may be used by pool owners to pay for pool management by TRAVA.FINANCE.
 5. **Payment for auction deposits:** In the NFT auction process, TRAVA tokens can be used as the deposit for purchase transactions.
 6. **Payment for auction organization:** The NFT‚Äôs owners (auction organizers) may pay for auction fees with TRAVA tokens.
 7. **Staking for a validator:** The data stored on the knowledge graph chain must be verified by validators. As an indication of commitment and service standard assurance, validators would be required to put up an amount of Trava token as a security deposit (i.e. a ""stake"") before being entitled to participate in the ecosystem. Where validators commit offences (e.g. incorrect information, unacceptable down-time, or other malicious acts), this stake may be slashed.
 8. **Staking to participate in the governance process:** The Trava token would allow holders to create and vote on on-chain governance proposals to determine future features of TRAVA.FINANCE, with voting weight calculated in proportion to the tokens staked (the right to vote is restricted solely to voting on features of TRAVA.FINANCE; it does not entitle Trava token holders to vote on the operation and management of the Company, its affiliates, or their assets or the disposition of such assets to token holders, or select the board of directors of these entities, or determine the development direction of these entities, does not constitute any equity interest in any of these entities or any collective investment scheme; the arrangement is not intended to be any form of joint venture or partnership). ####
Token Allocation
Total Supply ‚Äî Capped at **5,000,000,000 TRAVA**
We distribute tokenomics with a long-term vision and sustainability for the project. As a DEFI community lending solution, Trava reserves the most tokens (40%) for Liquidity Mining.
Trava believes that Marketing is one of the important criteria for business development. The tokenomics for it will be used to help expand Trava‚Äôs awareness, position our products and services, and boost customer acquisition.

The remaining components are distributed with the goal of ensuring fairness to investors, enhancing the attractiveness of the project, and developing successful products. Liquidity Mining‚Äî 40.0%, Marketing‚Äî 22.0%, Foundation‚Äî 20%, Listing‚Äî 2.0%, Team‚Äî 10%, Advisors‚Äî 6.0%. ####
Circulating supply
TRAVA.FINANCE tokenomics highlight a strong commitment and focus for the long term development. The token release schedule is extended until 2026, with a release curve designed to avoid supply shocks and make the release of tokens gradual over time.

**What are the TRAVA token and its utility?**
We issue TRAVA tokens based on Binance smart chain's BEP-20 standard; the total supply is 5 billion. These TRAVA tokens can be used in:
 * Reward: Pool owners can set up rewards paid by TRAVA token. Thus, lending pool depositors will earn rewards by TRAVA token.
 * Collateral and lending: Users can use TRAVA as mortgages. The users also loan TRAVA.
 * Payment for lending fees: Users can pay pool lending fees by TRAVA.
 * Payment for pool management: Pool owners can pay for the pool creation, update (e.g., pool parameters, add/remove tokens, ‚Ä¶), and pause by TRAVA.
 * Payment for auction deposits: in the NFTs auction process, TRAVA can be used as a locked asset.
 * Payment for auction organization: To perform all auction actions for NFT, the NFT‚Äôs owners (auction organizers) can pay the auction fees by TRAVA.
 * Staking for a data validator: To store credit data stored on the knowledge graph chain, the data must be confirmed by validators. The process is built up to eliminate redundant, unnecessary, and insecure data. The knowledge graph data validators stake by TRAVA.
 * Staking to participate in the governance process: TRAVA.FINANCE will become a community solution, thus the TRAVA.FINANCE‚Äôs rules are elected by participants, who hold TRAVA‚Äôs token."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08458646616541353 }, { ""content"": ""##

column1: If you have a specific action or pool in mind (e.g., staking TRAVA in Vault A or depositing BUSD in Pool X), I can help check the limits for that exact case.","Trava Finance does not impose strict limits on how much you can deposit or stake, but there are some practical and protocol-level considerations you should be aware of:
‚úÖ 1. No Fixed Deposit or Stake Limit

column3: There is no minimum or maximum deposit amount enforced by the Trava protocol itself.
You can deposit or stake any amount of supported tokens ‚Äî even small amounts (e.g., $1) ‚Äî as long as you have enough to cover gas fees.
On BNB Chain, gas fees are low (typically <$0.10), but:
If your deposit is too small, the gas cost may outweigh the benefits.
You may need to approve tokens before depositing/staking ‚Äî this step also costs gas.
Lending pools may have utilization caps:
If a pool is fully utilized (almost all funds borrowed), you may not be able to withdraw your deposit until more liquidity returns.
Some custom pools could impose caps per user or per asset, depending on the creator‚Äôs settings.

**How to deposit?**

 3. Select the asset you that you want to deposit from the available options
 4. Select the deposit button on the left and input the amount of the asset you want to stake
 5. Approve the transaction in your wallet. ##
**My earning**
Your earning depends on your depositing amount. The greater the amount, the greater the earning you get. The APY ratios for each type of asset are shown on the dashboard of the staking site, you can follow it anytime."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/staking-depositing-and-earning"", ""rrf_score"": 0.11688311688311688 }, { ""content"": ""##
Where are my deposited tokens stored?
After depositing, your deposit funds are stored in a smart contract. The code of the smart contract is public, open-source, formally verified, and audited by third-party auditors. You can withdraw your funds from the pool back to your wallet."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.10555555555555556 }, { ""content"": ""## **_Big prize to look for_**
While there is no loss to be concerned about, the winner may earn significantly more benefits than they would if they had deposited into the regular pool.
**_For example_** , assuming that we run a Fortune Mining pool for users to deposit DAI and gain 20.000 DAI in total deposited after one week. With APY at 1.5% (that is converted to APR at about 0,92%) and APR at 4.08%, respectively, two weeks later, the total reward for the winner will be calculated as:
**_20000*(0.92%+ 4.08%)/365*14 = 38.356 DAI._**
That means if you deposit 100 DAI at first and become the lucky one, you will receive about $38,356 (the interest rate at about 1000%) instead of $0,19 (the interest rate at about 5%).
As in the example above, the gap between the rewards you could get in a normal pool and the Fortune Mining pool is very significant. For that reason, this mini-game will be a good choice for those with small capital to try their luck and get much more money than usual. # **To sum up, what do you need to do to attain the benefits?**
_Step 1._ Deposit your token into the Fortune Mining Pool
 _Step 2._ Waiting for a certain period (depending on each campaign)
_Step 3_. Check the result:
 * If you are the lucky one: Congratulations, you get all the rewards from the pool
 * If you have not been lucky yet, don‚Äôt worry, you can withdraw your deposit or keep them in the pool, then try your luck in the next period.


_Notes: We will soon run a voting snapshot for our community to decide which asset should be put in the Fortune Mining pool. Stay tuned for that._"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/trava-mini-game-series-94dc54b20327"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""###

,What is the maximum amount can I borrow?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, the maximum amount you can borrow depends on several key factors ‚Äî there is no fixed global limit, but borrowing power is determined dynamically based on collateral value, loan-to-value (LTV) ratios, and pool configurations.

column3: The more collateral you supply, the more you can borrow.
The value of your collateral is determined by market prices of the assets you deposit.
Each collateral asset has a maximum LTV (e.g., 60%).
This means you can borrow up to 60% of the value of your collateral.

column1: If you supply $1,000 worth of BUSD, and BUSD‚Äôs LTV is 60%,
‚Üí You can borrow up to $600 in other supported assets.

column3: Each lending pool (especially custom pools) may set:
Maximum borrow per asset
Borrowing caps
Minimum collateral requirements
Supported asset pairs
Borrowing is limited to ensure your health factor stays above a critical threshold (usually > 1.0).
If your health factor drops too low due to price volatility, you risk liquidation.
Trava plans to enable credit-based borrowing using on-chain credit scores.
This could allow under-collateralized borrowing for users with strong credit.

LTV = 65%

Besides, you can not borrow if there is not enough liquidity or if your health factor is too low.","{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""##
**Is Borrowing assets more beneficial than Selling?**
If you sell your assets, you will lose the possession of this particular asset. It means you would be no longer entitled to the potential upside value gain. Whereas, by borrowing, you can still obtain these potential earnings (working capital) without losing your asset. You can borrow when unexpected expenses happen and leverage your holding assets for other investment opportunities. ##
**How to borrow?**
In order to borrow, you need to deposit any asset to be used as collateral first (check out the Depositing & Earning FAQ section for more info). After depositing, you simply go to the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù section and click the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù button on the asset you want to borrow. Input the amount and approve the transaction. The borrowed amount is based on the available deposits that you used as collateral. ##
**What is the maximum amount can I borrow?**
The maximum amount you can borrow depends on your deposited value and the available liquidity. Please notice the health factor and liquidation threshold indicators to guarantee your collaterals are in the state of safety. Besides, you can not borrow if there is not enough liquidity or if your health factor is too low. ##
**What type of asset do I repay my loans?**
When repaying a loan, the type of asset that you need to repay is in the same asset you borrowed. For example, if you borrow 1 BNB you will pay back 1 BNB plus interest accrued. Another way to pay back the loan is using your collateral. If you want to pay back the loan based on USD price you can borrow any of the available stable coins as USDC, DAI, USDT, etc. ##
**How much interest would I pay for my loans?**
When borrowing, the interest rate you need to pay depends on the borrowing rate which is determined from the supply and demand ratio of the asset. Moreover, the interest rate is a variable rate so that it changes constantly. The current borrowing rate of your borrowed assets is shown in the Borrowing section of your dashboard, you can check it any time."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/borrowing"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""##
I 
**Interest rate** An interest rate is the amount of interest due per period as a proportion of the amount lent, deposited, or borrowed. In the Trava Lending pool, the interest rate is designed to control liquidity risk while also maximizing utilization. ##
L 
**Lenders** Who play the role of liquidity providers in lending pools in the Trava Ecosystem.
**Liquidation penalty** A liquidation penalty is a bonus applied to the price of collateral assets purchased by liquidators as part of the liquidation of a loan that has reached the liquidation threshold.
**Liquidation Threshold** The percentage at which a position is defined as undercollateralized. For example, a Liquidation threshold of 80% means that if the value rises above 80% of the collateral, the position is undercollateralized and could be liquidated.
**LTV (Loan-to-Value)** A financial term used by lenders to express the ratio of a loan to the value of an asset purchased. ##
M 
**Maximum LTV** The maximum amount of currency that can be borrowed with specific collateral."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/"", ""rrf_score"": 0.10416666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""##
**Loan To Value**
The maximum amount that can be borrowed for a specific mortgage is determined by the Loan To Value (LTV) ratio. For example, if the LTV is 75%, borrowers will be allowed to borrow 0.75 ETH worth of corresponding currency for every 1 ETH worth of collateral.
For a wallet, the maximum LTV is calculated as the weighted average of LTVs of collateral assets and their value. In particular, for a wallet that deposits the collateral assets that are worth in dollars ,‚Ä¶,C_1, \dots ,C_n,‚Ä¶,, and their LTVs corresponding to LT,‚Ä¶,LTLTV_1, \dots , LTV_nLT,‚Ä¶,LT, maximum LTV is
√óLT+‚ãØ+√óLT+‚ãØ+\frac{C_1 \times LTV_1 + \cdots + C_n \times LTV_n }{C_1+\cdots+C_n}+‚ãØ+√óLT+‚ãØ+√óLT‚Äã ##
**Liquidation Threshold**
The liquidation threshold is the percentage at which a position is defined as undercollateralised. For example, a Liquidation threshold of 80% means that if the value rises above 80% of the collateral, the position is undercollateralised and could be liquidated.
The difference between the Loan To Value and the Liquidation Threshold is a safety cushion for borrowers.
For each wallet, the liquidation threshold is calculated as the weighted average of the liquidation thresholds of the collateral assets and their value. In particular, for a wallet that deposits the collateral assets that are worth in dollars ,‚Ä¶,C_1, \dots ,C_n,‚Ä¶,, and their liquidation threshold, respectively, L,‚Ä¶,LLT_1, \dots, LT_nL,‚Ä¶,L , the liquidation thresholds of wallet is
√óL+‚ãØ+√óL+‚ãØ+\frac{C_1 \times LT_1 + \cdots + C_n \times LT_n}{C_1 + \cdots + C_n}+‚ãØ+√óL+‚ãØ+√óL‚Äã"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/risk-management/risk"", ""rrf_score"": 0.10096153846153846 }, { ""content"": ""##

L 
**Lenders** Who play the role of liquidity providers in lending pools in the Trava Ecosystem.
**Liquidation penalty** A liquidation penalty is a bonus applied to the price of collateral assets purchased by liquidators as part of the liquidation of a loan that has reached the liquidation threshold.
**Liquidation Threshold** The percentage at which a position is defined as undercollateralized. For example, a Liquidation threshold of 80% means that if the value rises above 80% of the collateral, the position is undercollateralized and could be liquidated.
**LTV (Loan-to-Value)** A financial term used by lenders to express the ratio of a loan to the value of an asset purchased. ##
M 
**Maximum LTV** The maximum amount of currency that can be borrowed with specific collateral."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary"", ""rrf_score"": 0.09401709401709402 }, { ""content"": ""##
**Borrow rate**
The borrow rate is calculated using the current interest rate(per year) and is updated every second. That is, borrowers will be charged interest that changes every second. He must pay more interest if the Utilisation Rate is higher, and vice versa. Mathematically, at each time t, the Borrow rate (per second) is =/YB_t = R_t/Y where Y=31536000Y= 3153600031536000 is the number of seconds in a year. If the user is currently borrowing tokens then the interest payable is √óT_t \times B_t . The interest payable is accrued to the loan in the next second, that is T=(1+)T_{t+1}=T_t(1+B_t) . ##
**Deposit rate**
Deposit rate and Borrow rate are closely linked. Precisely, at each time , deposit rate is determined based on Utilization Rate and borrow rate and reserve factor . Precisely, deposit rate is defined by =√ó√ó(1‚àír)D_t = U_t \times B_t\times (1-r).
In terms of probability, is probability that each token is borrowed, thus is the average value of interest earned from each token deposited into the Pool. 
For deposit, the calculation of interest is updated after each operation deposit, withdraw, borrow, repay. In particular, if a user is currently depositing tokens, after a period of time \Delta{t} (in seconds) he will receive an interest of √ó√óŒît,T_t \times D_t \times \Delta{t}, and this interest is accrued to the deposited token, i.e. after time \Delta{t} he have Tt+Œît=√ó(1+√óŒît).T_{t+\Delta{t}} = T_t \times (1 + D_t \times \Delta{t}).=

**Is Borrowing assets more beneficial than Selling?**
If you sell your assets, you will lose the possession of this particular asset. It means you would be no longer entitled to the potential upside value gain. Whereas, by borrowing, you can still obtain these potential earnings (working capital) without losing your asset. You can borrow when unexpected expenses happen and leverage your holding assets for other investment opportunities. ##
**How to borrow?**
In order to borrow, you need to deposit any asset to be used as collateral first (check out the Depositing & Earning FAQ section for more info). After depositing, you simply go to the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù section and click the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù button on the asset you want to borrow. Input the amount and approve the transaction. The borrowed amount is based on the available deposits that you used as collateral. ##
**What is the maximum amount can I borrow?**
The maximum amount you can borrow depends on your deposited value and the available liquidity. Please notice the health factor and liquidation threshold indicators to guarantee your collaterals are in the state of safety. Besides, you can not borrow if there is not enough liquidity or if your health factor is too low. ##
**What type of asset do I repay my loans?**
When repaying a loan, the type of asset that you need to repay is in the same asset you borrowed. For example, if you borrow 1 BNB you will pay back 1 BNB plus interest accrued. Another way to pay back the loan is using your collateral. If you want to pay back the loan based on USD price you can borrow any of the available stable coins as USDC, DAI, USDT, etc. ##
**How much interest would I pay for my loans?**
When borrowing, the interest rate you need to pay depends on the borrowing rate which is determined from the supply and demand ratio of the asset. Moreover, the interest rate is a variable rate so that it changes constantly. The current borrowing rate of your borrowed assets is shown in the Borrowing section of your dashboard, you can check it any time."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/borrowing"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""##
**APR** Annual percentage rate (APR) refers to the yearly interest generated by a sum charged to borrowers or paid to investors.
**Available liquidity** The amount of a particular cryptocurrency asset that is available to borrow. ##
**Borrow** The activity of borrowing tokens from the lending pool.
**Borrow rate** A proportion of the borrowed amount borrowers need to pay the lenders every second.
**Borrowers** Who borrow digital assets with different interest rates, liquidity mining, and levels of risk. ##
C 
**Collateral** The cryptocurrency asset used by the borrower serves as a promise to repay the loan.
**Contract collector** A collector contract is a smart contract that receives a share of the protocol's interest allocated from the reserve factor.
**Cross-chain lending** A new type of lending that allows users to deposit and borrow digital assets spread across multiple blockchains. ##
D 
**Deposit** The activity of depositing tokens into the lending pool.
**Deposit rate** A proportion of the amount lent that lenders receive from the borrowers every second. ##
H 
**Health Factor** The numeric representation of the safety of deposited assets against the borrowed assets and their underlying value."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/"", ""rrf_score"": 0.125 }, { ""content"": ""##
**APR** Annual percentage rate (APR) refers to the yearly interest generated by a sum charged to borrowers or paid to investors.
**Available liquidity** The amount of a particular cryptocurrency asset that is available to borrow. ##
**Borrow** The activity of borrowing tokens from the lending pool.
**Borrow rate** A proportion of the borrowed amount borrowers need to pay the lenders every second.
**Borrowers** Who borrow digital assets with different interest rates, liquidity mining, and levels of risk. ##
C 
**Collateral** The cryptocurrency asset used by the borrower serves as a promise to repay the loan.
**Contract collector** A collector contract is a smart contract that receives a share of the protocol's interest allocated from the reserve factor.
**Cross-chain lending** A new type of lending that allows users to deposit and borrow digital assets spread across multiple blockchains. ##
D 
**Deposit** The activity of depositing tokens into the lending pool.
**Deposit rate** A proportion of the amount lent that lenders receive from the borrowers every second. ##
H 
**Health Factor** The numeric representation of the safety of deposited assets against the borrowed assets and their underlying value."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary"", ""rrf_score"": 0.1111111111111111 }, { ""content"": ""##
**What is Health factor?**
Health factor is an indicator which is used to evaluate the level of safety of your collateral assets against the borrowed assets and its underlying value. You should keep this indicator as high as possible because the higher the value is, the safer your loans are against liquidation scenarios. The liquidation of your deposits will be triggered if the health factor reaches 1. And if the health factor is below 1, your collateral can be liquidated. The health factor is determined depending on the liquidation threshold of your collateral against your borrowed funds. ##
**What is the meaning of health factor fluctuation?**
The health factor increases or decreases depending on the value fluctuation of your deposited amount. Your health factor increases is a positive indicator, it will improve your borrow position and protect your collateral far from being liquidated. In the case the health factor reduces, it means the value of your collateral assets against the borrowed assets also reduces, it can result in a risk of liquidation of your collaterals. ##
**When do I need to repay the loan?**
As long as you maintain your health factor safe, you can borrow for an undefined period. There is no fixed time period to pay back the loan. However, the accrued interest of your borrowing will grow day by day, making your health factor decrease. When it reaches the threshold of liquidation, your deposited assets are more likely to fall into liquidation status. ##
**How to repay the loan?**
In order to pay back the loan you go to the Borrowings section of your dashboard and click on the repay button for the asset you borrowed and want to repay. Select the amount to pay back and approve the transaction.

Brief description of Trava
TRAVA is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters such as borrow/supply interest rate, liquidation threshold, Loan-to-Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, TRAVA offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. TRAVA also offers the credit score function based on financial data on-chain analysis as a useful tool that reduces risk and increases profits for all users.
We build our solutions on TRAVA.FINANCE whose smart contracts are deployed on BSC network, so the speed of transactions, gas fees, and robustness depend on BSC network. However, in the near future, we will allow cross-chain lending in our platform.
Please join the the Trava team and members of the community look forward to helping you understand and use Trava. ##
Why should we trust Trava?
Trava Protocol has been audited and secured internally, by third parties (Hacken, Certik) and even Community Checks.
Check https://docs.trava.finance/security/ for more information. ##
**How to interconnect with Trava protocol**?
In order to interconnect with Trava protocol, you need to deposit your asset into lending pools. After depositing, you will earn passive income, this income is based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, you can also borrow by using your deposited assets as collateral. ##
Do I need to pay fees to interconnect with Trava protocol?
Interacting with the protocol requires transactions and so transaction fees for BSC Blockchain usage, which depend on the network status and transaction complexity."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""##

Read more details at BitMart website:"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/listing"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""# Trava Lending Market
This is the first lending market that allows users to not only deposit, and borrow assets, but also create and manage their own lending pools. Trava lending system consists of the Trava lending pool and 7 user-owned pools. Trava pool supports around 10 types of assets across 2 different blockchains (**BSC** and **Ethereum**), while the user-owned pools offer limitless possibilities based on user creativity and specific needs.
The lending pools on Trava Lending Market # Trava Staking
This is a staking protocol that allows users to deposit Trava Finance‚Äôs tokens ($TRAVA/ $rTRAVA) and BNB Chain‚Äôs token ($BNB). Users will then receive corresponding rewards based on their deposit and annual percentage rate (APR) of the staking vaults. Currently, there are **three available vaults** in Trava Staking which are shown in the picture below.
The available staking vaults of Trava Finance # Trava Governance
Trava Finance also aims to apply the DAO model to the entire system with , which allows users to propose and vote on changes to the ecosystem. Users can stake their TRAVA, rTRAVA, TRAVA/BNB for a period of time and receive veTRAVA ‚Äî voting power, which can be exchanged on veTRAVA Marketplace.
The mechanism of Trava Governance
** _About Trava.Finance_**
Trava Finance is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending, currently on the way to become an AI-driven Lending Station.
We provide both lending pools like normal approaches, and a more flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own pools. Applying AI technology and automation to our products, Trava Finance aims to bring users the most convenience in the DeFi space and complete decentralization in Web3.
Trava Finance is deployed on the Binance Smart Chain and allows for lending with BSC tokens first; we then enable cross-chain lending with various tokens on Ethereum and other blockchain networks.

,How much interest would I pay for my loans?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, the interest you pay on loans depends on several dynamic factors and varies by lending pool and asset. There is no fixed rate ‚Äî instead, Trava uses a variable interest rate model based on pool utilization.
üí∏ How Interest Works on Trava Loans

column3: The borrow interest rate increases as the pool becomes more utilized.
Utilization = the ratio of borrowed funds to total supplied liquidity.
Each pool may use a different interest rate model, especially custom-created ones.

column1: Trava uses models similar to Aave/Compound:
Borrow Interest Rate = Base Rate + (Utilization Rate √ó Multiplier)
Some pools may use jump-rate models, where interest increases sharply past a certain utilization threshold.
üîç 3. Where to View Your Loan Interest

column3: Go to the Borrow section of a pool.

column1: Would you like help estimating your specific interest for a certain amount or asset (e.g., borrow 1000 USDT for 14 days)?","The interest you pay on loans in Trava Finance depends on several dynamic factors. üî¢ Key Factors That Determine Loan Interest

column3: Each token has its own interest rate curve.

USDT: Might have lower rates due to high liquidity
BNB or volatile tokens: Usually higher interest rates
Higher utilization = higher interest.
Utilization is calculated as:

column1: Utilization Rate = Total Borrowed / Total Supplied

column3: As the pool gets more borrowed, interest rates increase to incentivize more supply.
Trava pools use a variable interest rate model with breakpoints. For example:
0‚Äì80% utilization: ~5‚Äì15% APR
80‚Äì100% utilization: Spikes to 20‚Äì40% or higher
Some custom pools may set different curves.

**Is Borrowing assets more beneficial than Selling?**
If you sell your assets, you will lose the possession of this particular asset. It means you would be no longer entitled to the potential upside value gain. Whereas, by borrowing, you can still obtain these potential earnings (working capital) without losing your asset. You can borrow when unexpected expenses happen and leverage your holding assets for other investment opportunities. ##
**How to borrow?**
In order to borrow, you need to deposit any asset to be used as collateral first (check out the Depositing & Earning FAQ section for more info). After depositing, you simply go to the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù section and click the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù button on the asset you want to borrow. Input the amount and approve the transaction. The borrowed amount is based on the available deposits that you used as collateral. ##
**What is the maximum amount can I borrow?**
The maximum amount you can borrow depends on your deposited value and the available liquidity. Please notice the health factor and liquidation threshold indicators to guarantee your collaterals are in the state of safety. Besides, you can not borrow if there is not enough liquidity or if your health factor is too low. ##
**What type of asset do I repay my loans?**
When repaying a loan, the type of asset that you need to repay is in the same asset you borrowed. For example, if you borrow 1 BNB you will pay back 1 BNB plus interest accrued. Another way to pay back the loan is using your collateral. If you want to pay back the loan based on USD price you can borrow any of the available stable coins as USDC, DAI, USDT, etc. ##
**How much interest would I pay for my loans?**
When borrowing, the interest rate you need to pay depends on the borrowing rate which is determined from the supply and demand ratio of the asset. Moreover, the interest rate is a variable rate so that it changes constantly. The current borrowing rate of your borrowed assets is shown in the Borrowing section of your dashboard, you can check it any time."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/borrowing"", ""rrf_score"": 0.15476190476190477 }, { ""content"": ""##
I 
**Interest rate** An interest rate is the amount of interest due per period as a proportion of the amount lent, deposited, or borrowed. In the Trava Lending pool, the interest rate is designed to control liquidity risk while also maximizing utilization. ##
L 
**Lenders** Who play the role of liquidity providers in lending pools in the Trava Ecosystem.
**Liquidation penalty** A liquidation penalty is a bonus applied to the price of collateral assets purchased by liquidators as part of the liquidation of a loan that has reached the liquidation threshold.
**Liquidation Threshold** The percentage at which a position is defined as undercollateralized. For example, a Liquidation threshold of 80% means that if the value rises above 80% of the collateral, the position is undercollateralized and could be liquidated.
**LTV (Loan-to-Value)** A financial term used by lenders to express the ratio of a loan to the value of an asset purchased. ##
M 
**Maximum LTV** The maximum amount of currency that can be borrowed with specific collateral."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/"", ""rrf_score"": 0.125 }, { ""content"": ""##
I 
**Interest rate** An interest rate is the amount of interest due per period as a proportion of the amount lent, deposited, or borrowed. In the Trava Lending pool, the interest rate is designed to control liquidity risk while also maximizing utilization. ##
L 
**Lenders** Who play the role of liquidity providers in lending pools in the Trava Ecosystem.
**Liquidation penalty** A liquidation penalty is a bonus applied to the price of collateral assets purchased by liquidators as part of the liquidation of a loan that has reached the liquidation threshold.
**Liquidation Threshold** The percentage at which a position is defined as undercollateralized. For example, a Liquidation threshold of 80% means that if the value rises above 80% of the collateral, the position is undercollateralized and could be liquidated.
**LTV (Loan-to-Value)** A financial term used by lenders to express the ratio of a loan to the value of an asset purchased. ##
M 
**Maximum LTV** The maximum amount of currency that can be borrowed with specific collateral."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary"", ""rrf_score"": 0.1111111111111111 }, { ""content"": ""##
**Borrow rate**
The borrow rate is calculated using the current interest rate(per year) and is updated every second. That is, borrowers will be charged interest that changes every second. He must pay more interest if the Utilisation Rate is higher, and vice versa. Mathematically, at each time t, the Borrow rate (per second) is =/YB_t = R_t/Y where Y=31536000Y= 3153600031536000 is the number of seconds in a year. If the user is currently borrowing tokens then the interest payable is √óT_t \times B_t . The interest payable is accrued to the loan in the next second, that is T=(1+)T_{t+1}=T_t(1+B_t) . ##
**Deposit rate**
Deposit rate and Borrow rate are closely linked. Precisely, at each time , deposit rate is determined based on Utilization Rate and borrow rate and reserve factor . Precisely, deposit rate is defined by =√ó√ó(1‚àír)D_t = U_t \times B_t\times (1-r).
In terms of probability, is probability that each token is borrowed, thus is the average value of interest earned from each token deposited into the Pool. 
For deposit, the calculation of interest is updated after each operation deposit, withdraw, borrow, repay. In particular, if a user is currently depositing tokens, after a period of time \Delta{t} (in seconds) he will receive an interest of √ó√óŒît,T_t \times D_t \times \Delta{t}, and this interest is accrued to the deposited token, i.e. after time \Delta{t} he have Tt+Œît=√ó(1+√óŒît).T_{t+\Delta{t}} = T_t \times (1 + D_t \times \Delta{t}).=

**How to avoid being liquidated?**
In order to avoid collateral liquidation, you need to maintain your health factor at a safe level. To increase health factor, you can pay back a part of your loans or deposit more assets for your borrowing amount. Among two available options, repaying the loan would increase your health factor more. We mention you should keep your health factor over 2.

**Is Borrowing assets more beneficial than Selling?**
If you sell your assets, you will lose the possession of this particular asset. It means you would be no longer entitled to the potential upside value gain. Whereas, by borrowing, you can still obtain these potential earnings (working capital) without losing your asset. You can borrow when unexpected expenses happen and leverage your holding assets for other investment opportunities. ##
**How to borrow?**

After depositing, you simply go to the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù section and click the ‚ÄúBorrow‚Äù button on the asset you want to borrow. Input the amount and approve the transaction. The borrowed amount is based on the available deposits that you used as collateral. ##
**What is the maximum amount can I borrow?**
The maximum amount you can borrow depends on your deposited value and the available liquidity. Please notice the health factor and liquidation threshold indicators to guarantee your collaterals are in the state of safety. Besides, you can not borrow if there is not enough liquidity or if your health factor is too low. ##
**What type of asset do I repay my loans?**
When repaying a loan, the type of asset that you need to repay is in the same asset you borrowed. For example, if you borrow 1 BNB you will pay back 1 BNB plus interest accrued. Another way to pay back the loan is using your collateral. If you want to pay back the loan based on USD price you can borrow any of the available stable coins as USDC, DAI, USDT, etc. ##
**How much interest would I pay for my loans?**
When borrowing, the interest rate you need to pay depends on the borrowing rate which is determined from the supply and demand ratio of the asset. Moreover, the interest rate is a variable rate so that it changes constantly. The current borrowing rate of your borrowed assets is shown in the Borrowing section of your dashboard, you can check it any time."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/borrowing"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""##
Brief description of Trava
TRAVA is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters such as borrow/supply interest rate, liquidation threshold, Loan-to-Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, TRAVA offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. TRAVA also offers the credit score function based on financial data on-chain analysis as a useful tool that reduces risk and increases profits for all users.
We build our solutions on TRAVA.FINANCE whose smart contracts are deployed on BSC network, so the speed of transactions, gas fees, and robustness depend on BSC network. However, in the near future, we will allow cross-chain lending in our platform.
Please join the the Trava team and members of the community look forward to helping you understand and use Trava. ##
Why should we trust Trava?
Trava Protocol has been audited and secured internally, by third parties (Hacken, Certik) and even Community Checks.
Check https://docs.trava.finance/security/ for more information. ##
**How to interconnect with Trava protocol**?
In order to interconnect with Trava protocol, you need to deposit your asset into lending pools. After depositing, you will earn passive income, this income is based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, you can also borrow by using your deposited assets as collateral. ##
Do I need to pay fees to interconnect with Trava protocol?
Interacting with the protocol requires transactions and so transaction fees for BSC Blockchain usage, which depend on the network status and transaction complexity."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""##
**What is Health factor?**
Health factor is an indicator which is used to evaluate the level of safety of your collateral assets against the borrowed assets and its underlying value. You should keep this indicator as high as possible because the higher the value is, the safer your loans are against liquidation scenarios. The liquidation of your deposits will be triggered if the health factor reaches 1. And if the health factor is below 1, your collateral can be liquidated. The health factor is determined depending on the liquidation threshold of your collateral against your borrowed funds. ##
**What is the meaning of health factor fluctuation?**
The health factor increases or decreases depending on the value fluctuation of your deposited amount. Your health factor increases is a positive indicator, it will improve your borrow position and protect your collateral far from being liquidated. In the case the health factor reduces, it means the value of your collateral assets against the borrowed assets also reduces, it can result in a risk of liquidation of your collaterals. ##
**When do I need to repay the loan?**
As long as you maintain your health factor safe, you can borrow for an undefined period. There is no fixed time period to pay back the loan. However, the accrued interest of your borrowing will grow day by day, making your health factor decrease. When it reaches the threshold of liquidation, your deposited assets are more likely to fall into liquidation status. ##
**How to repay the loan?**
In order to pay back the loan you go to the Borrowings section of your dashboard and click on the repay button for the asset you borrowed and want to repay. Select the amount to pay back and approve the transaction.
