,What is Trava pool creation?,"Trava Pool Creation is a core feature of Trava Finance that allows any user to create and manage their own decentralized lending pool with customizable parameters ‚Äî something not typically available in traditional DeFi platforms like Aave or Compound.
According to the official documentation, this feature supports flexible, community-driven lending markets, tailored to specific needs, risk profiles, or tokens.

column1: Would you like a template or walkthrough to launch your own lending pool with specific tokens and parameters?","Trava Pool Creation is a unique feature in the Trava Finance protocol that allows users to create and manage their own decentralized lending pools with customizable settings. This is a powerful tool that sets Trava apart from traditional DeFi platforms like Aave or Compound, which only offer shared global pools.
It enables you to launch a new lending/borrowing pool where you control the rules. Think of it as building your own mini-bank on the blockchain.
üß± What Can You Customize in a Trava Pool?

column2: Choose which tokens your pool accepts for lending and borrowing
Define how much collateral is required to borrow each token
Set dynamic APR curves based on utilization
Control when and how loans are liquidated
You can charge fees and earn a share of interest generated in your pool
Create public or private pools (whitelisted users or open to all)

column1: Trava pool creation is ideal for:

column3: DAOs or communities wanting to launch branded lending services
Project owners building GameFi or NFT ecosystems with native assets
Institutions customizing risk for internal or external users
DeFi developers experimenting with new lending models
Earn fees from borrowers in your pool
Set your own risk rules
Incentivize communities to use your pool via rewards
Build niche lending markets (e.g., for rare NFTs or metaverse assets)

column1: üöÄ How to Create a Trava Pool (Step-by-Step)

Fee structure
Confirm and deploy the pool on-chain (requires gas fee)
Optionally, fund it with initial liquidity or invite lenders

column2: You‚Äôll pay BNB to deploy the pool contracts

,What are Trava Multi-pool Ecosystem components?,"The Trava Multi-pool Ecosystem is a key innovation of Trava Finance, enabling a flexible, modular lending environment where multiple independent lending pools can coexist and serve different needs, use cases, or risk appetites.

According to the official documentation, the Multi-pool Ecosystem is composed of several integrated components that work together to support custom lending pool creation, risk assessment, governance, and cross-pool operations.

Trava Pool Creation Components
In the Trava Multi-pool Ecosystem, there are three main components: - **Pool Owners** : Who create and manage their own lending pools. - **Users** : who use lending services (of Trava lending pool and user-owned lending pools) such as borrowing, depositing, etc. - **Trava Governance** : Who plays the significant roles in the decision-making process while running the ecosystem.
Each of these components has its own roles and responsibilities that are shown in the infographic below:
As shown on the infographic, while pool owners can freely add new tokens (set risk parameters included) or set reserve conditions, they need to assist Governance‚Äôs opinion if wanting to make changes after that."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/user-guide/trava-pool-creation-user-guide"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""# Decentralized Lending Marketplace: The Ultimate Vision Of Trava
Published in
6 min readDec 8, 2022
Share
Decentralized Lending Marketplace: The Ultimate Vision Of Trava
 _From the beginning, Trava has set the goal of creating a Decentralized Lending Marketplace. Each of the crucial milestones leads to the ultimate vision of Trava, a Decentralized Lending Marketplace where users can create and manage their own pools to build their own lending business. For a better understanding of this long-term goal, this writing will provide an overview of the Decentralized Lending Marketplace._
Trava Ecosystem # What is a Decentralized Lending Marketplace?
A Decentralized Lending Marketplace is considered the final long-term goal of the Trava ecosystem. In this goal, users will be able to create and manage lending pools with their own parameters, which are based on certain requirements of Trava, to have their own lending business. With the support of the Users-owned Pool feature and the Trava Lending Pool, Trava is step by step achieving the goal of building a totally Decentralized Lending Marketplace, where the benefits of users are being put above all.
In the Trava ecosystem, the Decentralized Lending Marketplace involves two main lending services of Trava, including Trava Lending Pool and Pool Creation, and several supporting features, such as Trava Knight NFT to support the NFT-collateralization in the Lending Services, Trava Governance to enhance the decentralization aspect, etc. # Key Components of Trava Decentralized Lending Marketplace"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/decentralized-lending-marketplace-the-ultimate-vision-of-trava-28872e395e85?source=collection_home_page----75e285c42203-----36-----------------------------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""## [AMA Recap] For the Growth of Trava‚Äôs Finance Ecosystem

,How to avoid being liquidated?,"To avoid being liquidated on Trava Finance, you must actively manage your borrowing position to maintain a safe health factor and respond to market changes. Trava follows standard DeFi liquidation mechanisms, where loans are liquidated if the value of your collateral falls too low relative to your debt.
Based on the official documentation, here‚Äôs how you can prevent liquidation:
You will be liquidated if your Health Factor drops below 1.0.
HF = (Collateral Value √ó Liquidation Threshold) / Debt Value

column3: A Health Factor > 1.5 is considered safe.
If it approaches 1.1 or below, your position is at high risk.

column1: You can check your current health factor in the ‚ÄúMy Borrowings‚Äù section on Trava Station.

column3: Falling collateral prices can reduce your HF.
Rising interest rates can increase your debt.

column1: Set alerts or regularly monitor crypto market prices and your borrowing status.

column3: Reduces the total debt, improving your HF.
You can repay partially at any time.
Increases your total collateral value.
Also improves your borrowing power and health factor.
Don‚Äôt max out your borrowing limit.
Stay well below the maximum allowed to buffer against volatility.
Stablecoins (e.g., BUSD, USDT) are less likely to drop in value suddenly.
High-volatility assets like BTC or ETH are riskier if used as collateral.
Some pools have more conservative LTV and liquidation thresholds.
Review pool settings before borrowing.

column1: Would you like help calculating your current health factor, or setting up a simulation to test how much price drop would trigger liquidation for your position?","To avoid being liquidated on Trava Finance, you need to actively manage your collateral and loan position to stay above the protocol‚Äôs risk thresholds. Here‚Äôs a complete guide:
Liquidation happens when your borrowed amount plus interest exceeds the maximum allowed borrowing limit, based on the value of your collateral and the Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio.

column3: Never borrow the maximum allowed amount.
Aim to borrow 50‚Äì60% of your borrowing power (not 80‚Äì90%).
Your collateral value can drop with market volatility.
Example:
You supplied $1,000 of BNB
BNB drops 30% ‚Üí Collateral is now $700
You‚Äôre suddenly near liquidation if your loan is >$500

column1: ‚úÖ Use stablecoins (e.g., USDT, BUSD) as collateral if you want less risk from price drops.

column3: Repaying part of your loan reduces risk.
Interest compounds over time ‚Äî even small repayments help keep your borrow usage ratio low.
You can deposit more collateral at any time to improve your collateral ratio.
Especially useful when the market is dipping.
Trava shows a ‚Äúhealth factor‚Äù for your position:
HF > 1.5 ‚Üí Safe
HF < 1.1 ‚Üí At risk
HF = 1 ‚Üí Liquidation imminent

column1: Health Factor = (Collateral Value √ó Liquidation Threshold) / Total Borrowed

column3: Use portfolio trackers (like DeBank, Zapper, or Trava‚Äôs own dashboard) to set alerts when:
Collateral drops
Borrowed usage increases
Health factor falls near 1.2

column1: 7. ‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid Illiquid or Volatile Tokens as Collateral

column3: Assets with low liquidity or sharp volatility may:
Be harder to liquidate
Be more prone to price crashes
Use blue-chip tokens (BNB, ETH, stablecoins) for safer collateral

column2: Add more BNB or repay loan
Repay part of loan or reduce borrow
Check if you‚Äôre over-utilizing your limit
Track how close you are to danger
Two key ways to boost safety

,What are key functionalities in Trava Lending Pool?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, the Trava Lending Pool includes several powerful and customizable functionalities that set it apart from traditional DeFi lending protocols.
üîë Key Functionalities in Trava Lending Pool

column3: Users can deposit assets into a lending pool to earn interest.
Supplied assets become available for other users to borrow.
Interest is earned dynamically based on asset utilization rate.
Users can borrow assets by supplying collateral from the pool.
The maximum borrow amount is determined by the Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of the collateral.
Interest accrues until the loan is repaid.
Users must supply collateral to borrow.
Each asset has a defined:
Collateral factor (LTV)
Liquidation threshold
The system calculates a Health Factor to monitor safety.
Borrow and supply rates adjust automatically based on supply and demand.
Higher pool utilization ‚Üí higher interest rates for borrowers and higher rewards for lenders.
If a borrower‚Äôs health factor < 1, their position becomes eligible for liquidation.
Third-party liquidators can repay part of the debt and seize discounted collateral.
This maintains the solvency of the pool.
A unique Trava feature: users can create their own lending pools.
Pool creators can customize:
Supported assets
Risk parameters (e.g., interest models, LTV, liquidation threshold)
Fee structures
Great for DAOs, niche markets, or community-based lending.
Lenders can withdraw their assets at any time (as long as liquidity is available).
Borrowers can repay loans partially or fully whenever they wish.
Users can track:
Supply/borrow balances
Accrued interest
Health factor
Pool utilization rates
Asset APY/APR
Credit scoring system (used/planned) for evaluating borrower risk
Integrated liquidation market
Governance via TRAVA token

column2: Unique to Trava; user-defined lending pools
View your position and pool stats instantly

column1: Would you like a comparison between Trava Lending Pool vs Aave/Compound, or a guide to create your own custom pool?","The Trava Lending Pool is the core module of the Trava Finance protocol, enabling decentralized lending and borrowing of crypto assets. It supports advanced functionality and customization beyond traditional DeFi platforms.
Here are the key functionalities of Trava Lending Pools:
üîë Key Functionalities in Trava Lending Pool

column3: Users can deposit supported tokens (e.g., USDT, BNB, BUSD) into the lending pool.
Earn interest over time, based on pool utilization.
Deposits are tokenized (e.g., receive tUSDT for supplying USDT).
Users can borrow tokens by putting up collateral.
Borrowing limits are based on:
Token-specific Loan-to-Value (LTV)
Collateral value
Risk configuration of the pool
Interest rates are variable, based on pool utilization.
Higher demand ‚Üí higher borrow rates ‚Üí higher lender rewards.
Supports multiple collateral types per user.
Assets used as collateral affect your borrowing power and health factor.
If a borrower‚Äôs health factor falls below 1.0:
Collateral can be liquidated by third parties.
Ensures protocol solvency and lender protection.
Borrowers can repay at any time.
Interest is charged per block and stops upon repayment.
Partial repayments reduce risk of liquidation.
Lenders can withdraw their deposits at any time,
Unless funds are in use (borrowed).

With the mission to create a ground-breaking lending protocol and give a great opportunity to all users, **Trava Lending Pool** , which allows users to deposit, and borrow assets in Trava‚Äôs Pool to make profits, is one of the most crucial services of Trava. By participating in this pool, which now supports above 15 assets, users can now get enormous earnings in an effortless manner. ## Key Functionalities of Trava Lending Pool
* Deposit: Users can deposit their assets to Trava Pool to earn rewards with high APY and APR, which depend on the deposit/borrowing demand in the pool.
 * Borrow: When users want to use a type of asset to do business without selling their holding assets, they can deposit these available assets as collateral to borrow favorable assets. In this way, they can still do business on any assets they want without losing their holding assets.
 * Withdraw: After depositing, users can withdraw their cryptocurrencies anytime they want. However, as the deposit‚Äôs interest accrues over time, so the longer the deposit period, the bigger the interest they will earn.
 * Repay: When borrowing, users can pay back all or part of their loans. Users should adequately manage their repaying to avoid being liquidated collateral. ## Trava User-Owned Pools
The current lending projects overlook the potential of more than 1200 less-dominant tokens and miss the opportunity to make profits from them. Trava saw the problems that might hold the bullish growth of Lending projects and started to find the answer to it, which is to support as many assets as possible. The idea of supporting more assets led Trava to the thought that we need to support more users, which means we are product-oriented and user-oriented at the same time.
With a clear mission, the Trava Pool Creation is established. The function solves the current problems mentioned above by allowing projects and individuals to create and manage their own lending pools. As a result, they can add less-dominant assets to earn instead of solely focusing on the top tokens.

Was this helpful?"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/user-guide/trava-pool-creation-user-guide"", ""rrf_score"": 0.125 }, { ""content"": ""## Pool owners
Users may easily and quickly start their own lending businesses as pool owners. In more specific terms, they might construct lending pools with digital assets of varying risk levels, which are now only available in the TRAVA Ecosystem. ## Lenders
Lenders play the role of liquidity providers in lending pools in the Trava system. They can not only add their major tokens into pools, but they also lend digital assets such as NFTs, etc., since Trava allows multiple assets for lending and borrowing.
With a variety of pools created in the Trava lending system, there are many options for liquidity providers to lend tokens in many different lending pools. Thus, they have more opportunities to optimize their earnings through interest rates paid by borrowers and rewards from the liquidity mining program by Trava. ## Borrowers
Besides pool owners and lenders, borrowers play significant roles in a lending pool in the TRAVA lending ecosystem. Borrowers have more options to borrow digital assets with different interest rates, liquidity mining, and levels of risk.
In addition, various types of assets are used as collateral. In the near future, TRAVA Knight NFT is also expected to become one of these assets to give our users more opportunities to borrow more tokens.
_To support all roles in the Lending Services, Trava offers users unique features such as BRicher, parameter recommendation, credit score, cross-chain lending, etc. As ‚Äúassistance,‚Äù these features will help users to come up with the best investing decision. For example, the data analytics services based on knowledge graphs will show pool owners crucial information about lenders, borrowers, assets, and other factors that will aid them in developing a reasonable plan for their pools._ # Trava Milestones towards the Decentralized Lending Marketplace"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/decentralized-lending-marketplace-the-ultimate-vision-of-trava-28872e395e85?source=collection_home_page----75e285c42203-----36-----------------------------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.11309523809523808 }, { ""content"": ""# What Makes Trava Finance Lending Services Different?
While Trava Finance is a DeFi lending platform, it stands out from others by providing**Trava Pool Creation** for users to create and manage their pools. This feature is a crucial and unique aspect that makes Trava Finance becomes a Decentralized Lending Marketplace with a multi-pool ecosystem.
By applying Pool Creation, users can have many additional advantages compared to other lending services and especially can gain more benefits while being **pool owners** in the system.
With Pool Creation,**pool owners** will receive the yield from the gap between the lending and borrowing interest (the yield will also be distributed to Trava Finance at a reasonable proportion). As for organizations, they can also gain more utility for the tokens that they added to the pool and gain more awareness as well as recognition. In addition, pool owners can also achieve the experience and required skills to manage a crypto lending pool successfully.
In terms of **depositors and borrowers** , they will have various pools to choose from. Depositors and Borrowers can determine the pools with suitable parameters for their purposes.
**Borrowers** can have more options to borrow digital assets with different interest rates, liquidity mining, and levels of risk. In addition, various types of assets are used as collateral. In the near future, TRAVA Knight NFT is also expected to become one of these assets to give our users more opportunities to borrow more tokens.
As **Lenders** , users have more choices to lend tokens in many different lending pools. Thus, they have more opportunities to optimize their earnings through interest rates paid by borrowers and rewards from the liquidity mining programs of multi-pools.
In the process of Creating, Managing, and Joining the Pool, pool owners, depositors, and borrowers will be supported by many Analytic Tools from Trava Finance to have the most appropriate parameters for the pool. # About Trava Finance
Trava Finance is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters, such as borrow/supply interest rate, liquidation threshold, Loan-to-Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, TRAVA offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. Trava is deployed on the Binance Smart Chain and allows for lending with BSC tokens first; we then enable cross-chain lending with various tokens on Ethereum and other blockchain networks.

N 
**NET APY** The Net APY shows the APY over all assets deposited and borrowed.
**NFT-Collateralization** A function that allows Trava Knight NFTs to be used as collateral in the Trava Lending pool. ##
P 
**Pool owners (For pool creation)** When the Trava Pool Creation is implemented, users may easily and quickly start their own lending businesses as pool owners. In more specific terms, they might construct lending pools with digital assets of varying risk levels, which are now only available in the Trava Ecosystem. ##
R 
**Repay loan** The activity of paying back money previously borrowed from the lending pool.
**Reserve Factor** The reserve factor allocates a share of the protocol's interests to a collector contract as a reserve for the ecosystem.
**Reserve size** The amount of a particular cryptocurrency asset held in the lending pool.
**Risk parameters** Parameters are set for each asset to avoid the risk and maintain the sustainable development of the lending pool, including LTV, Liquidation Threshold, Reserve factor, etc.
**rTRAVA** The reward token you receive from borrowing, depositing in the Trava Lending pool, and farming in the Heuristic program (Trava Knight NFT). The $rTRAVA is pegged to the $TRAVA, with a conversion rate of 1:1. ##
T 
**Total Borrowed** The total amount of a particular asset borrowed in the lending pool.
**Total Deposited** The total amount of a particular asset deposited in the lending pool.
**Transaction fee** A transaction fee is paid when a certain amount of cryptocurrency is transferred from one wallet to another.
**Trava Finance marketplace** A platform that combines the Trava lending pool and multiple user-owned pools for the goals of borrowing and lending assets.
**Trava Pool Creation** The goal of Trava Finance as allowing users to create and manage their own pools to start a lending business to generate a total decentralized marketplace.
**TVL (Total value locked)** TVL is the total value held in the Trava Lending pool."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08571428571428572 } ] }",False,False,False,False,FALSE,False,,,,"['https://docs.trava.finance/user-guide/lending-pool-user-guide', 'https://blog.trava.finance/official-launch-of-trava-lending-pool-and-liquidity-mining-program-a9b3e65cb2e5']","['List of tokens supported by TRAVA  DAI USDC USDT WETH WBNB BTCB BUSD  CAKE  XRP', 'Accepting Assets The first version of Trava lending pool supports seven types of assets in the pool, including: USDT USDC DAI BUSD WBTC WETH BNB In addition, other tokens will be supported later.']",0.8785718679428101,0.8692650198936462,True,True

,What is users‚Äô credit score?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, a user‚Äôs credit score is a DeFi-native reputation system that evaluates the trustworthiness and risk profile of a wallet address based on its on-chain activity, particularly in lending and borrowing.
üß† What Is a User‚Äôs Credit Score on Trava?
The Trava Credit Score is a numerical rating assigned to a wallet that reflects how responsibly it behaves in the DeFi ecosystem. It is used to:

column3: Assess borrowing risk
Potentially support under-collateralized or lower-collateral lending
Enable personalized loan terms in the future

column1: üìä What Factors Influence the Credit Score?
Trava uses both on-chain data and behavioral analytics to calculate credit scores. Key factors may include:

column2: Timely and full repayments improve your score
Maintaining a safe health factor and avoiding liquidation
Regular, responsible use of lending/borrowing features
Broader DeFi activity across networks (if tracked)
Being liquidated can negatively impact your score
Trusted users may borrow with reduced collateral
Users with high scores may get preferential terms
Pools can customize terms based on your score

column1: You can view your credit score via:

column3: Trava Station ‚Üí After connecting your wallet, go to the Credit Score or User Profile section.
Credit score is wallet-specific (linked to your address).
Not all pools currently use the score, but future Trava lending pools may use it to adjust risk and terms.
The scoring model may evolve over time as Trava integrates machine learning and cross-chain behavior analysis.

column1: Would you like help understanding how to raise your score or simulate how certain actions affect it?","In Trava Finance, a user‚Äôs credit score is a decentralized risk profile that reflects the creditworthiness and borrowing behavior of a wallet. While it‚Äôs not a traditional numeric score like in centralized finance (e.g., FICO), Trava uses AI and on-chain data to assign a risk level or reputation status to each user based on their activity.
üß† What Is a User‚Äôs Credit Score in Trava?
It‚Äôs a composite risk evaluation that considers:

column3: Your borrowing and repayment history
Loan-to-value (LTV) usage
Liquidation events
Collateral diversity and quality
Frequency and consistency of DeFi activity
How much you can borrow
Your interest rate in custom pools
Your liquidation risk buffer
Potential privileges in curated lending pools
Evaluates patterns of wallet activity
Detects potential exploit behavior or high-risk practices
May flag or boost wallets for custom pool access

column2: Some pools may only accept low-risk borrowers
Safer borrowers might get better borrowing power
Weight or eligibility may vary by reputation
Used to assess risk of NFT-backed loans

column1: üßæ How to Improve Your Trava Credit Score

column2: A DeFi-native risk profile or borrower reputation score
To influence borrowing limits, pool access, and interest rates
Trava protocol, pool creators, and possibly the public (on-chain)
Repay loans, avoid liquidation, use diverse and safe collateral

content"": ""In the financial sector, a credit score is a value that represents the creditworthiness of an individual; the higher the score, the better a borrower looks to potential lenders. Credit score evaluation is a distinctive technique that differentiates TRAVA.FINANCE and other decentralized lending approaches. TRAVA.FINANCE aggregates and analyzes all transactions of blockchain objects (e.g., user, wallet address, digital asset) on multiple networks. TRAVA.FINANCE then establishes links among them and evaluates their credit score in the most objective and transparent manner. ""}]

content"": ""TRAVA.FINANCE uses credit scores to ensure the safety of the lending process. Pool owners and lenders can rate borrowers‚Äô credit and eliminate fraudulent accounts to increase capital efficiency and reduce the risk of bad debt. Based on the credit scores, they can determine the maximum Loan-To-Value ratio for borrowers. Borrowers with high credit scores get preferential treatment; they can borrow cryptos with more favorable interest rates and Loan-To-Value ratios. ""}]","https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score

Credit score evaluation is a distinctive technique that differentiates TRAVA.FINANCE and other decentralized lending approaches. TRAVA.FINANCE aggregates and analyzes all transactions of blockchain objects (e.g., user, wallet address, digital asset) on multiple networks. TRAVA.FINANCE then establishes links among them and evaluates their credit score in the most objective and transparent manner.

TRAVA.FINANCE uses credit scores to ensure the safety of the lending process. Pool owners and lenders can rate borrowers‚Äô credit and eliminate fraudulent accounts to increase capital efficiency and reduce the risk of bad debt. Based on the credit scores, they can determine the maximum Loan-To-Value ratio for borrowers. Borrowers with high credit scores get preferential treatment; they can borrow cryptos with more favorable interest rates and Loan-To-Value ratios. ","{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""##
**What is users‚Äô credit score?**
In the financial sector, a credit score is a value that represents the creditworthiness of an individual; the higher the score, the better a borrower looks to potential lenders. Credit score evaluation is a distinctive technique that differentiates TRAVA.FINANCE and other decentralized lending approaches. TRAVA.FINANCE aggregates and analyzes all transactions of blockchain objects (e.g., user, wallet address, digital asset) on multiple networks. TRAVA.FINANCE then establishes links among them and evaluates their credit score in the most objective and transparent manner. ##
**What benefits does credit score brings to users?**
-For borrowers, the primary benefit is that they can borrow with a ""preferential interest rate"" if their credit score is high. They can also receive higher loan-to-value-ratio compared to other users
For lenders, who have high credit scores easily become LPs of different pools. Moreover, when they create a pool, their pool will have a higher credit score because the pool creator's credit score is also a criterion for the pool scoring. Especially, pool owners can rate borrowers‚Äô credit and eliminate fraudulent accounts to increase capital efficiency and reduce the risk of bad debt."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""##
**How Credit scores for wallet addresses are calculated?**
To evaluate credit scores for wallet addresses, TRAVA credit scoring model will take into account 5 factors:
 1. Total asset: represents the financial strength of the address.
 2. Transaction history: TRAVA aggregates all transactions of a wallet address across all platforms to calculate various parameters such as (i) transaction amount, (ii) number of liquidations, etc.
 3. Loans ratio: represents the debt position of an account, including the Loan-to-balance ratio and Loan-to-investment ratio.
 4. Circulating asset: represents how active users are in the crypto market, contains (i) investment-to-total-asset ratio and (ii) ROE.
 5. The last parameter is the trustworthiness of possessing assets. At present, TRAVA evaluates two types of digital assets: (i) token and NFT.


Each above parameter is normalized to the range of [0, 1000], using a standardized score function that converts z-scores to the range. The z-score is calculated from the mean and the standard deviation from every corresponding parameter of all accounts. To be more specific, you can read this function in TRAVA whitepaper. ##
**How the user's credit score will be updated?**
Our system has both periodic updates and instant updates. The instant update occurs when users actively make transactions such as deposit, withdraw, repay... Or when users view their credit score on our app. In case a user has not viewed their credit score and had no transactions for a long time, their credit score is still updated periodically and automatically, which can be weekly or monthly. We are still trying to optimize it."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08928571428571427 }, { ""content"": ""##
A 
**Age of the wallet (day)** The period that the wallet has participated in the crypto market since its first transaction.
**Average Credit Score** The average amount of credit score within a given period of a wallet address.
**Average Increasing** The average rate of growth that the credit score increase within a given period of a wallet address. ##
C 
**Circulating asset (Credit Score parameters)** The circulating-asset-to-total-asset ratio represents how active users are in the crypto market. The more money they invest in the crypto market, the more creditworthiness they gain from others.
**Credit Score (Œ±-version)** A value that represents the creditworthiness of borrowers; a user with a high credit score would have a chance to be approved for a loan with favorable interest rates.
**Credit Score Distribution** The distribution of credit scores for all users based on 5 different levels, including Warrior, Conqueror, Hero, Master, and Legendary.
**Credit Score Histogram** A graphical representation that organizes the group of people with different credit score levels.
**Credit Score History** A record of the credit score in the past.
**Credit Score range** Is the range of credit scores which is from 0 to 100.
**Credit score strategy** The suggestions of the different ways to improve the credit score.
**Cross-chain Identification** The function used to verify that multiple addresses on different chains belong to the same users.
**Cross-chain Knowledge graph** One of the components of Trava Finance which is responsible for storing and representing aggregated data from multiple blockchain networks.
**Current Reputation** The real-time reputation rank. ##
H 
**Holders distribution score** The standardized value that evaluates the equal distribution of the token among holders. ##
L 
**Loan ratios (Credit Score parameters)** Loan ratios (debt ratios) represent the debt position of an account. ##
M 
**Marketcap score in tokens health analytics** The standardized value of the total dollar market value of the token. ##
N 
**Number of holders score in tokens health analytics** The standardized value of the total number of token holders.
**Number of the monitoring days** The number of days that you want to monitor the credit scores.
**Number of Transactions chart** The chart shows the number of transactions categorized into 4 groups (i.e., deposit, borrow, withdraw, repay) in a lending pool.
**Number of transaction scores in token health analytics** The standardized value of the total number of transactions related to the token in the last 24 hours, 7 days, and 100 days. ##
P 
**Price score in tokens health analytics** The quotient of the current token price and the highest token price in the last 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, 100 days, and all-time.
**Price stability score in tokens health analytics** The standardized value that evaluates the stability of the token price in the last 24 hours, 7 days, and 100 days."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/analytics-glossary"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""## Trava Credit Scoring for DFYN Holders on Polygon Network

,How Credit scores for wallet addresses are calculated?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, credit scores for wallet addresses are calculated using a combination of on-chain behavioral data, lending/borrowing history, and machine learning models to assess the risk level of each user in a decentralized way.
üß† How Trava Calculates Credit Scores for Wallets
The credit scoring mechanism analyzes multiple dimensions of wallet activity to produce a numerical score that reflects the trustworthiness and reliability of the user.
üìä Key Factors in Credit Score Calculation

column2: Timely and consistent repayment of borrowed assets positively affects your score.
Healthy collateral ratios and avoiding close-to-liquidation levels are rewarded.
Being liquidated reduces your credit score.
Regular, responsible borrowing builds a stronger credit history.
Trava may integrate external on-chain data to enhance scoring accuracy.
Longer-term, stable wallets with more interactions are often scored higher.

column3: Trava uses AI/ML models to analyze behavioral patterns and predict risk.
The system is designed to learn over time, improving its ability to distinguish between low- and high-risk users.
This model helps enable under-collateralized or variable-rate lending in future Trava lending pools.

column1: üßæ Example: What Might Affect Your Score
Opening multiple loans with high utilization
column2: ‚ö†Ô∏è Neutral to Negative depending on context

column1: Long-term use of Trava and other DeFi platforms

column3: ‚úÖ Credit scores are calculated automatically and updated dynamically.
üéØ Scores are wallet-specific and serve as a trust signal for Trava pools.
üîê Used for future support of under-collateralized loans or personalized loan terms.

column1: Would you like a sample credit score simulation or suggestions on how to improve your score as a new user?","In Trava Finance, credit scores for wallet addresses are calculated using a combination of on-chain data, protocol interaction history, and AI-driven risk assessment models. While Trava does not assign a literal numeric ‚Äúcredit score‚Äù like FICO, it builds a dynamic risk profile for each wallet to assess how trustworthy and stable that address is as a borrower.
üß† How Trava Calculates Credit Scores (Wallet Risk Profiles)

column3: Repayment History: On-time repayments increase trust.
Default or Liquidation Events: If your wallet was liquidated, that negatively impacts the score.
Partial Repayments: Show proactive debt management and reduce risk.
The platform tracks how aggressively you borrow relative to your collateral.
Safer users keep their health factor high (HF > 1.5).
Risky users borrow close to liquidation thresholds (HF ‚âà 1.0).
High-quality, low-volatility tokens (e.g., USDT, BUSD) improve your score.
Using volatile or illiquid assets as collateral is seen as riskier.
Collateral spread across multiple assets reduces systemic risk.
Longer history of lending, borrowing, and repaying builds a better reputation.
Wallets that engage in spammy or exploit-like behavior are flagged.
NFT-based lending is evaluated with NFT price volatility and liquidity data.

column1: Trava‚Äôs AI risk engine monitors behavioral patterns such as:

column3: Collateral value changes over time
Reactions to market dips
Borrow frequency and ratios across pools
Correlation with bad-debt wallets (to avoid sybil attacks or flash loan exploits)

column1: These weights are indicative ‚Äî actual scoring uses AI models, not fixed formulas.

column3: To restrict or allow access to certain lending pools
To adjust maximum borrow amounts dynamically
To provide better interest rates to trustworthy borrowers (in custom pools)
For risk-based analytics in the protocol‚Äôs backend

column1: ‚úÖ How to Improve Your Wallet‚Äôs Credit Score
Repay loans early or on time
Avoid borrowing close to max limit

content"": ""The credit score evaluation in TRAVA.FINANCE is primarily based on on-chain data. At present, we collect, enrich, and analyze Binance Smart Chain transactions, including the native transferring transactions and the transactions to deposit, withdraw, repay, and borrow tokens generated from Binance Smart Chain lending DApps.

The credit rating of digital assets helps pool owners and liquid providers to minimize liquidity risk. TRAVA.FINANCE divides digital assets into two categories: Tokens/coins and other digital assets (e.g., NFT, smart contracts, stoke tokens) and evaluates their credit scores. The credit score of a Token is assessed based on 4 parameters, i.e., (i) the token price, (ii) the market cap (MC) of the token, (iii) the token trading volume, and (iv) the number of transactions related to the token. High-credit-score tokens have a great advantage over low-credit-score tokens. Once being used as collaterals, they offer high loan-to-value ratios to borrowers; lenders also get favorable lending interest rates with their high-credit-score tokens. ,How the user's credit score will be updated?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, a user‚Äôs credit score is updated automatically and dynamically based on their on-chain activity, particularly related to borrowing and lending behavior within Trava‚Äôs ecosystem.
üîÑ How Is a User‚Äôs Credit Score Updated?
Trava monitors your wallet‚Äôs interaction with the protocol in real time. Actions that affect your score include:

column3: Borrowing
Repayment
Collateral changes
Liquidations

column1: Each event contributes to a credit history profile, which the scoring system uses to evaluate and adjust your score.

column3: Trava uses a machine learning-based scoring engine.
The system ingests your behavioral data and recalculates your risk profile.
The score is periodically updated to reflect new activity (e.g., successful repayments or liquidations).

column1: You can check your latest credit score by:

column3: Logging in to Trava Station
Viewing the Credit Score section in your dashboard

column1: Updates are visible as soon as the scoring engine processes your recent actions.

Would you like a simulation of how a specific action (e.g. repaying a loan or being liquidated) affects your score numerically?","In Trava Finance, a user‚Äôs credit score (risk profile) is dynamically updated on-chain and/or via Trava‚Äôs off-chain AI engine based on real-time activity and historical behavior. It evolves with every key action you take on the protocol.
üîÑ How Your Credit Score Gets Updated

column3: Repaying loans on time ‚Üí improves your creditworthiness
Late or partial repayment ‚Üí neutral or mildly positive
Getting liquidated ‚Üí negatively impacts your score

column1: üí° Every loan you open or close influences your credit profile.

column3: Your Health Factor (HF) is constantly tracked:
If HF consistently stays above 1.5, it‚Äôs seen as low risk
If HF approaches 1.0 often, it‚Äôs flagged as high-risk behavior

column1: ‚ö†Ô∏è Even if you‚Äôre not liquidated, frequent close calls may degrade your score.

column3: Collateral is re-evaluated over time:
Stablecoins (USDT, BUSD) ‚Üí positive risk signal
Volatile tokens (e.g., CAKE, meme coins) ‚Üí riskier profile
NFTs ‚Üí creditworthiness depends on NFT value stability and liquidity
The score updates as your borrowed amount / collateral value changes:
Borrowing too close to your max limit ‚Üí higher risk
Keeping large unused borrowing capacity ‚Üí safer user
Trava‚Äôs AI analyzes:
Frequency of borrowing/repaying
Liquidation trends over time
Asset correlations (e.g., if you‚Äôre part of exploit-like patterns)
Reaction to market volatility (do you top up collateral or ignore?)

column2: You borrow, repay, get liquidated, or deposit
AI models may re-evaluate based on behavior trends
Health factor or LTV breaches a defined limit
Pools may apply updated scoring logic dynamically

column1: üìà Where You Might See the Score Change

column3: Your borrowing limit may adjust up/down
Some custom pools may block risky users
You may get better or worse APR terms in future pools
Analytics dashboards may show updated credit classification

content"": ""Our system has both periodic updates and instant updates. The instant update occurs when users actively make transactions such as deposit, withdraw, repay... Or when users view their credit score on our app. In case a user has not viewed their credit score and had no transactions for a long time, their credit score is still updated periodically and automatically, which can be weekly or monthly. We are still trying to optimize it. ""}]
content"": ""To evaluate credit scores for a wallet address, TRAVA.FINANCE credit scoring model will take into account the following factors:

Total asset. The total asset represents the financial strength of the wallet address; it is the most intuitive and easiest-to-evaluate parameter. It is also the second most important parameter that affects credit scores. The total asset is the sum of balance and total investment minus total liabilities. The credit score of the address is proportional to its total asset. As this parameter is a volatility index, the credit score is calculated based on both the average total asset in a certain period and the total current asset.

Transaction history. Transaction history is the most important parameter; it has a major impact on credit scores. TRAVA.FINANCE collects and aggregates all exchanges, loans, deposits, and other transactions of the wallet address across multiple DApps to calculate various intermediate parameters such as (i) the age of the address, (ii) its transaction amount, (iii) its frequency of transaction, (iv) its number of liquidations and (v) its total value of liquidations.
Loan ratios. Loan ratios (debt ratios) represent the debt position of the account. It is divided into two sub-parameters, i.e., loan-to-balance ratio and loan-to-investment ratio.

Circulating assets. This parameter represents how active users are in the crypto market. The more money they invest in the crypto market, the more creditworthiness they gain from others. This parameter is evaluated based on 2 sub-parameters, (i) investment-to-total-asset ratio and (ii) ROE (Return on equity).

Trustworthiness of possessing assets. The last parameter for credit rating is the trustworthiness of the assets owned by the wallet address. The wallet can improve its credit score by possessing high-value and trustworthy digital assets. At present, TRAVA.FINANCE evaluates two types of digital assets only (i.e, Token and NFT).""}]",https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score https://docs.trava.finance/whitepaper/credit-score-evaluation,"Our system has both periodic updates and instant updates. The instant update occurs when users actively make transactions such as deposit, withdraw, repay... Or when users view their credit score on our app. In case a user has not viewed their credit score and had no transactions for a long time, their credit score is still updated periodically and automatically, which can be weekly or monthly. We are still trying to optimize it.  \\\
To evaluate credit scores for a wallet address, TRAVA.FINANCE credit scoring model will take into account the following factors:

Total asset. The total asset represents the financial strength of the wallet address; it is the most intuitive and easiest-to-evaluate parameter. It is also the second most important parameter that affects credit scores. The total asset is the sum of balance and total investment minus total liabilities. The credit score of the address is proportional to its total asset. As this parameter is a volatility index, the credit score is calculated based on both the average total asset in a certain period and the total current asset.

Transaction history. Transaction history is the most important parameter; it has a major impact on credit scores. TRAVA.FINANCE collects and aggregates all exchanges, loans, deposits, and other transactions of the wallet address across multiple DApps to calculate various intermediate parameters such as (i) the age of the address, (ii) its transaction amount, (iii) its frequency of transaction, (iv) its number of liquidations and (v) its total value of liquidations.
Loan ratios. Loan ratios (debt ratios) represent the debt position of the account. It is divided into two sub-parameters, i.e., loan-to-balance ratio and loan-to-investment ratio.

Circulating assets. This parameter represents how active users are in the crypto market. The more money they invest in the crypto market, the more creditworthiness they gain from others. This parameter is evaluated based on 2 sub-parameters, (i) investment-to-total-asset ratio and (ii) ROE (Return on equity).

Trustworthiness of possessing assets. The last parameter for credit rating is the trustworthiness of the assets owned by the wallet address. The wallet can improve its credit score by possessing high-value and trustworthy digital assets. At present, TRAVA.FINANCE evaluates two types of digital assets only (i.e, Token and NFT).","{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""##
**How Credit scores for wallet addresses are calculated?**
To evaluate credit scores for wallet addresses, TRAVA credit scoring model will take into account 5 factors:
 1. Total asset: represents the financial strength of the address.
 2. Transaction history: TRAVA aggregates all transactions of a wallet address across all platforms to calculate various parameters such as (i) transaction amount, (ii) number of liquidations, etc.
 3. Loans ratio: represents the debt position of an account, including the Loan-to-balance ratio and Loan-to-investment ratio.
 4. Circulating asset: represents how active users are in the crypto market, contains (i) investment-to-total-asset ratio and (ii) ROE.
 5. The last parameter is the trustworthiness of possessing assets. At present, TRAVA evaluates two types of digital assets: (i) token and NFT.


Each above parameter is normalized to the range of [0, 1000], using a standardized score function that converts z-scores to the range. The z-score is calculated from the mean and the standard deviation from every corresponding parameter of all accounts. To be more specific, you can read this function in TRAVA whitepaper. ##
**How the user's credit score will be updated?**
Our system has both periodic updates and instant updates. The instant update occurs when users actively make transactions such as deposit, withdraw, repay... Or when users view their credit score on our app. In case a user has not viewed their credit score and had no transactions for a long time, their credit score is still updated periodically and automatically, which can be weekly or monthly. We are still trying to optimize it."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score"", ""rrf_score"": 0.16666666666666666 }, { ""content"": ""##
**What is users‚Äô credit score?**
In the financial sector, a credit score is a value that represents the creditworthiness of an individual; the higher the score, the better a borrower looks to potential lenders. Credit score evaluation is a distinctive technique that differentiates TRAVA.FINANCE and other decentralized lending approaches. TRAVA.FINANCE aggregates and analyzes all transactions of blockchain objects (e.g., user, wallet address, digital asset) on multiple networks. TRAVA.FINANCE then establishes links among them and evaluates their credit score in the most objective and transparent manner. ##
**What benefits does credit score brings to users?**
-For borrowers, the primary benefit is that they can borrow with a ""preferential interest rate"" if their credit score is high. They can also receive higher loan-to-value-ratio compared to other users
For lenders, who have high credit scores easily become LPs of different pools. Moreover, when they create a pool, their pool will have a higher credit score because the pool creator's credit score is also a criterion for the pool scoring. Especially, pool owners can rate borrowers‚Äô credit and eliminate fraudulent accounts to increase capital efficiency and reduce the risk of bad debt."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score"", ""rrf_score"": 0.14285714285714285 }, { ""content"": ""##
**Where can I see my credit score?**
Go to https://scoring.trava.finance/credit-score/orai and connect your wallet, you will see your credit score right on the screen."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score"", ""rrf_score"": 0.0625 }, { ""content"": ""### üëâGo to: https://scoring.trava.finance/credit-score-strategy

Jan 10, 2022"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/?source=post_page---post_publication_info--79146094a347---------------------------------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.0625 }, { ""content"": ""##
**Which objects does Trava evaluate credit score for?**
At the moment, Trava has been evaluating the credit scores for 3 types of Objects: Wallet addresses (users), tokens, and NFTs. ##
**How to increase my credit score?**
To improve the credit score of your wallet, you would need to take into account our five parameters, i.e., Total asset, Transaction history, Loans ratios, Circulating assets, and Trustworthiness of possessing assets. For instance, you should increase your wallet balance with prestige coins and tokens, perform more transactions and become more active in the crypto market, maintaining good Loan-to-balance and Loan-to-investment ratios, supply more liquidity to lending pools, trade on lending DApps to earn as much profit as you can, avoid collateral liquidation while borrowing, and possess at least $1000 valuable token (e.g., Bitcoin, Ether, or BNB).
Besides, you need to be credible users for a long time. It is because to avoid fraud, TRAVA calculates some credit score parameters based on their average values in the last k days, where k depends on the volatility of the crypto market. Moreover, some parameters are assessed based on the ‚Äústandardized score‚Äù function, which calculates the mean and the standard deviation of all accounts‚Äô parameters. Thus, trying to be the best at some criteria would improve your credit score too. ##
**Why did my credit score decrease?**
The reasons why your credit score drops might be: You have bad transactions such as borrowing liquidations, your balance decrease, your borrowing rate is higher, you are not active enough, etc...You can read our white paper to understand how the credit score mechanism functions. https://docs.trava.finance/whitepaper/credit-score-evaluation

,How to increase my credit score?,"To increase your credit score on Trava Finance, you need to demonstrate responsible and consistent on-chain behavior ‚Äî especially around lending and borrowing. Trava‚Äôs credit scoring system is designed to reward trustworthy users with better scores, potentially enabling more favorable loan terms in the future (such as under-collateralized borrowing).
Based on the official documentation, here‚Äôs how to improve your score:
üìà How to Increase Your Credit Score on Trava

column3: Always repay borrowed assets fully and promptly.
Even partial repayments help demonstrate responsibility.
Late or missed repayments can reduce your score.
Keep your Health Factor well above 1.0 (preferably >1.5).
This shows you manage risk well and reduces chances of liquidation.
Being liquidated (due to a drop in collateral value or over-borrowing) has a negative impact on your score.
Monitor your position regularly and top up collateral if needed.
Don‚Äôt max out your borrowing limit ‚Äî leave a safe margin.
Repeated responsible borrowing improves your long-term credit profile.
Trava may reward active, long-term users.
A consistent history of borrowing, repaying, and collateral management boosts your reputation.
Supply and borrow across multiple assets and pools (if available).
This can show you‚Äôre a sophisticated and engaged user.
Visit: https://station.trava.finance
Go to Dashboard ‚Üí Credit Score
Check your current score and activity log (if available)

column1: Would you like a personalized plan or simulation to boost your score over the next 30 days based on your current wallet activity?","To increase your credit score on Trava Finance (i.e., improve your wallet‚Äôs risk profile), you should focus on responsible borrowing behavior, collateral safety, and avoiding liquidation. Trava‚Äôs credit scoring system uses AI and on-chain data to evaluate trustworthiness, so your actions are continuously monitored and scored.
‚úÖ Top Strategies to Increase Your Trava Credit Score

column3: Timely repayment shows you‚Äôre a reliable borrower.
Early repayment can further reduce your perceived risk.
Avoid leaving long-term outstanding loans near the limit.

column1: üü¢ Positive impact: Builds trust and lowers default risk.

column3: Keep your Health Factor > 1.5 (ideally > 2.0).
This shows you‚Äôre not borrowing aggressively against your collateral.

column1: üõ°Ô∏è Example: If you can borrow $1,000, only use $500‚Äì600 max.

column3: Deposit stablecoins (USDT, BUSD) or blue-chip assets (BNB, ETH) as collateral.
Avoid volatile or illiquid tokens unless needed.

column1: ‚úÖ Stable collateral = lower risk = higher score.

column3: Pay off small or near-liquidation loans.
Consolidate borrowings into low-risk positions.

column1: üîΩ Less debt = less risk to the protocol.
5. üîÑ Top Up Collateral During Market Dips

column3: When crypto prices drop, add more collateral to keep your loan safe.
Shows active and responsible risk management.

column1: üí° Trava‚Äôs AI rewards proactive behavior, not just results.

column3: Use multiple tokens or NFT assets instead of concentrating all value in one.
Trava may view a diversified wallet as less vulnerable to single-asset crashes.
One liquidation event can sharply reduce your credit score.
Set alerts or monitor your dashboard regularly.

column1: ‚ùå Liquidation = major negative mark on your profile.

column3: Having a long-term pattern of borrowing and repaying steadily improves your credit reputation.

column1: üìà Just like a real-world credit score: consistency builds trust.

Most reliable way to gain trust

,Why did my credit score decrease?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, your credit score may decrease due to behaviors or events that increase your perceived risk as a borrower or protocol participant. The score is dynamic and reflects on-chain activity associated with your wallet.
‚ùå Common Reasons Your Credit Score May Decrease

column3: If your position was liquidated (i.e., your Health Factor dropped below 1), your score will decrease.
Liquidation indicates poor risk management and damages your on-chain credit reputation.
Although Trava loans accrue interest continuously, a long delay in repayment or ignoring growing debt may negatively impact your score.
Keeping your position close to the liquidation threshold (e.g., Health Factor ‚âà 1.0) over time shows risky behavior.
Even if not liquidated, this can lower your trust score.
Continuously borrowing near your maximum borrow limit (based on your collateral) without proper management can reflect poorly.
Over-leveraged accounts are considered higher risk.
If you borrow and leave the loan unmonitored or without interaction for a long time, the scoring system may treat it as neglect.
Repeatedly:
Borrowing just below safe limits
Ignoring pool risk signals
Withdrawing collateral without rebalancing the loan

column1: can result in a cumulative drop in score.

column2: Go to Trava Station and review borrow history

column1: Would you like help analyzing your credit score history or building a recovery strategy to increase it again?","Your credit score (risk profile) on Trava Finance may have decreased due to one or more risky actions or changes detected by Trava‚Äôs on-chain and AI-based risk monitoring system. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of common reasons your score could drop:
‚ùå Top Reasons Your Credit Score Decreased on Trava

column3: If your health factor dropped below 1.0, your position was likely liquidated.
Even one liquidation negatively impacts your score significantly.
It‚Äôs treated as a major default event.
If your collateral token lost value (e.g., BNB or an NFT crashed), your health factor also dropped.
Even if you weren‚Äôt liquidated, a low collateral-to-debt ratio signals higher risk.

column1: 3. ‚ö†Ô∏è Borrowed Too Close to the Limit

column3: If you borrowed 90‚Äì100% of your borrowing capacity, your health factor hovered near 1.0.
This risky behavior is flagged by Trava‚Äôs AI, even without liquidation.
Long-term borrowing without any partial repayments may trigger a negative update.
Trava may assume higher risk if no action is taken over time.
If you used highly volatile tokens or NFTs as collateral, your profile may be downgraded.
These assets carry unpredictable price swings, which affect repayment confidence.
If your collateral was concentrated in just one token or NFT collection, it increases risk.
Lack of diversification can lead to sudden score drops when that asset weakens.
Trava may update risk models based on market volatility or new data.
This can cause score recalibration across all wallets ‚Äî even without your direct action.

column2: Major event that reduces trust sharply
Indicates high risk of future liquidation
Using full borrow limit = high risk
Viewed as passive or disengaged behavior

column1: If you share your recent activity (e.g., assets borrowed, collateral type, or if you were liquidated), I can help you identify exactly why your score dropped and how to rebuild it efficiently.",docs,"[{""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/trava-credit-score"",

,How to attend Trava NFT Auction?,"To attend the Trava NFT Auction, you need to participate through the official Trava Station platform, where the Trava Knight NFTs are auctioned using a bidding mechanism. column1: ‚úÖ 2. Navigate to the NFT Auction Page

column1: Would you like help setting up your wallet for the auction or an alert for the next NFT drop?","To attend a Trava NFT Auction, you need to follow a few steps involving a Web3 wallet and BNB Chain. ü™ô How to Attend Trava NFT Auction (Step-by-Step)

column3: Use MetaMask, Trust Wallet, or any wallet that supports BNB Chain (BEP-20).

Go to: https://app.trava.finance
Navigate to the ‚ÄúNFT Auction‚Äù section (check homepage or dropdown menu).
Click ‚ÄúConnect Wallet‚Äù (top right)
Choose MetaMask or WalletConnect depending on your device
You‚Äôll see:
Current NFT listings
Starting price & current highest bid
Time remaining for each auction
NFT details (utility, rarity, visual preview)
Select the NFT you want to bid on.
Enter your bid amount (usually in BNB or TRAVA tokens depending on the auction).
Click ‚ÄúPlace Bid‚Äù, and approve the transaction in your wallet.

column1: üìù Some auctions may require a minimum increment over the last bid.

After the auction ends, if you‚Äôre the highest bidder:
You can claim the NFT directly from the auction page.
It will be transferred to your wallet.

Used as collateral in NFT lending pools
Staked for rewards

Auction is ONLY cancellable when it has NO BIDS. After the first bid comes in, neither you nor we can cancel it, as rules are written in the smart contract.
When the bidding countdown is less than 5 minutes left, every new bid will extend the countdown by 5 minutes;
Each bid price will be increased by at least 5% of the previous one. Once the countdown ends, the auction item will be obtained by the last/highest bidder;

The most important rule: 2.5% of the price increase for each bid is distributed to the previous bidder, and the remaining 97.5% would be the income of the auction publisher if it‚Äôs the last bid or returned to the bidder when it‚Äôs outbid.

With the rules, each bidder would either take the 5% share of the next bid or obtain the auction Knight with the price he/she offered. And the first bidder will additionally be free from distributing his/her own 5% to other people.

Note: The percentage that the later bidder pays for the earlier bidder is the same as the percentage that the sellers need to pay for the platform. So, 2.5% is also the amount auction publishers pay to the marketplace, which means that after receiving 97.5% of the final bidding price as income, sellers need to pay 2.5% of the income to the NFT marketplace.
Therefore, the final payment rate that the sellers receive is 95.06% of the final bid. This fee is utilized for marketing, operating, and functioning.
Receive: ~95.06% of the final bidding price

‚áí Then, Billy would get 97.5% of his 1100 TRAVA and 2.5% of 1200 TRAVA, that is 1102.5 TRAVA, still getting 30 TRAVA for free.

**Does Trava apply NFTs in the ecosystem?**
Yes, TRAVA allows users to use all of these asset types as collaterals. Before that, the special digital assets must be priced through auctions. The auction winners are involved in the lending contract. They can either possess the digital asset at a low price or earn a considerable profit from the contract. ##
**How does Trava price NFTs?**
Trava will provide the auction function for NFT assets. Thus, the NFT's owners can open an auction session to price the NFT. The auction winner can buy directly the NFT or he/she can join in a collateral smart contract by locking their NFT's payment. In this way, we can price, and put NFT into the lending process. Besides, our approach also helps increase the liquidity for NFT because the asset can be used in the lending business in an easy way. We also avoid the price fluctuation of NFT because the NFTs have been priced in the auction contract before. ##
**What can I do with NFTs after the auction?**
TRAVA.FINANCE auction mechanism is divided into two modes: auction-to-sell and auction-for-buy-right. The difference between two modes is the ownership of the digital asset after the auction. In the auction-to-sell mode, as soon as the auction ends and the auction winner pays the fee, he/she will immediately receive the auctioned NFT.
Meanwhile, in the auction-for-buy-right mode, the winner cannot immediately buy the digital asset. After a certain amount of time specified in the auction, if the NFT owners cannot repay the loan, the auction winner can buy it at a low price. Otherwise, they get a considerable interest if the NFT owners repay the loan and get their NFT back.

**Trava NFT Auction**
Coming soon"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/nfts/future-scope"", ""rrf_score"": 0.13333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""NFT has become an increasingly popular way to buy and sell digital artwork. They are non-fungible, which naturally means that they are illiquid. Bringing liquidity to the NFT space would unlock a myriad of possibilities. As of May 2021, there have been no lending projects that make use of NFT as collaterals, because unlike a fungible currency or common stock, NFT value is difficult to determine. TRAVA.FINANCE adds more flexibility to the illiquid world of NFT and allows NFT owners to earn an ROI without selling it.
TRAVA.FINANCE offers an innovative feature that prices NFTs based on auctions. After the auction, borrowers can use their NFTs as collateral. TRAVA.FINANCE auction mechanism is divided into two modes: auction-to-sell and auction-for-buy-right. The difference between two modes is the ownership of the digital asset after the auction. In the auction-to-sell mode, as soon as the auction ends and the auction winner pays the fee, he/she will immediately receive the auctioned NFT. Meanwhile, in the auction-for-buy-right mode, the winner cannot immediately buy the digital asset. After a certain amount of time specified in the auction, if the NFT owners cannot repay the loan, the auction winner can buy it at a low price. Otherwise, they get a considerable interest if the NFT owners repay the loan and get their NFT back.
The auction process is as follows:
 1. The NFT owner opens an auction session; she sets (i) the legal crypto used in the auction, (ii) the initial price for her NFT, (iii) the countdown time for the auction session, (iv) the mode for her auction (i.e., _auction-to-sell or auction-for-buy-right_), and other auction terms.
 2. TRAVA.FINANCE users, who are interested in the NFT, can join in the auction session. To encourage users to participate in auctions, at the end of the auction, TRAVA.FINANCE randomly selects several bidders and rewards them with TRAVA tokens extracted from the auction fees. To guarantee that the bidders make their payment when they win the auction, TRAVA.FINANCE locks a number of their TRAVA tokens as soon as they join in the auction session and make a bid. When the auction finishes, they will immediately get their tokens back if they are not the winner. In case they are the winners, they can get their tokens back only if they pay for the auctioning NFT before the deadline.
 3. In the _auction-to-sell_ mode, the auction winner will pay the owner the whole auction price to get the NFT.
 4. In the _auction-for-buy-right_ mode, the auction winners have to pay a part of the auction price. We name the quotient of the amount the winners have to pay over the auction price ""_auction-paid ratio_ ‚Äù. The auction-paid ratio is calculated from the creditworthiness of the lender, borrower, NFT, and the auction terms. The NFT owners can use the cryptos paid by the auction winner as collateral for their loans. Once they repay their loan including the interest to the auction winners, they can get the NFT back. Otherwise, they will lose their NFT to the auction winners. These rules are all defined in the auction smart contract.


TRAVA.FINANCE provides benefits for all participants as described below.
 * **NFT owners** can determine their NFT value based on the bid prices given by the auction participants. The value can be much greater than their initial expectation. They can either directly sell their NFT or use their NFT as collateral and earn profit without losing it. TRAVA.FINANCE thus increases the liquidity of NFTs and opens up a unique and exciting NFTFi marketplace.
 * Based on the given number of auction bids, **bidders** have a corresponding chance to win the reward at the end of the auction session. This rewarding mechanism provides incentives for users to actively make a bid in the auction.
 * **Auction winners** can get their desired NFT at a price lower than their bidding price (once NFT owners cannot repay the loan) or they can receive considerable interest from their loan to NFT owners (once NFT owners repay the loans and get their NFT back).
 * The credit scores of **NFT owners, auction winners, bidders,** and **NFTs** can be improved after auctions.


The auction mechanism for NFT can also be applied to any type of digital asset. In our road map, TRAVA.FINANCE will implement this auction feature for various types of digital assets (e.g., stock token, smart contract).

column1: Would you like help evaluating the value of a Knight NFT, or a preview of current or upcoming Knight auctions? I can assist with that too.","blog, docs","[{""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/trava-knight-nft-introduction-to-auction-mechanism-version-1-eb72e6f97be4"",
content"": ""Benefit for those who participate in the Trava Knight auction

Auction publishers (or sellers) are those who open auctions for their Knights. Opening an auction allows auction publishers to set up their price floor for their Knights, which determines their minimum desired price, helping them avoid selling their Knights at an unwanted low price compared to the market price.

The auction opens a great opportunity for Knight owners to make profits without the need of disassembling their Knights to pieces and selling each item multiple times, which can cause wasted gas fees due to multiple transactions.

Trava Knight auction is of benefit for bidders since it offers them the opportunity to get the full Knight, not every piece of armoury NFT on Trava NFT Marketplace. This helps bidders save more time in obtaining a Knight without finding and collecting armoury items to assemble.

The auction also offers bidders an excellent method to get their favorable Knights, which suits their needs for missions such as Farming, Expedition, Farming with EXP and PvP tournaments in the future.
The NFT Auction is the first step toward Trava Finance‚Äôs long-term aim of allowing NFTs to be used as collateral in the Trava Lending pool.

By using an auction mechanism, the NFT will be priced and subsequently used as collateral in the Trava loan pool. This is a good method to vary the collaterals and give users more opportunities to lend assets.

Each of Knight and Armory NFTs represents a unique digital collectible that can be bought, sold, rented and put on auction on Trava Knight NFT Marketplace. It helps increase the utility of not only NFTs for NFT-collateralization, but also $TRAVA in our system as all the trading on the Marketplace is in $TRAVA.

Users can assemble Knight NFTs to join Trava Farming Programs (NFT Farming, Heuristic Farming) in different vaults for a great APY ‚Äî the rarer the NFT, the higher APY. The longer staked in the vaults, Loyal Knight NFT holders will also have more benefits in our lending pool in the future.
In addition, you can get rewards from Trava Knight NFTs by playing the Battle Hand Mini-Game, and joining in Missions such as Expedition or Treasure Map.
content"": ""TRAVA.FINANCE provides benefits for all participants as described below.

NFT owners can determine their NFT value based on the bid prices given by the auction participants. The value can be much greater than their initial expectation. They can either directly sell their NFT or use their NFT as collateral and earn profit without losing it. TRAVA.FINANCE thus increases the liquidity of NFTs and opens up a unique and exciting NFTFi marketplace.

Based on the given number of auction bids, bidders have a corresponding chance to win the reward at the end of the auction session. This rewarding mechanism provides incentives for users to actively make a bid in the auction.

Auction winners can get their desired NFT at a price lower than their bidding price (once NFT owners cannot repay the loan) or they can receive considerable interest from their loan to NFT owners (once NFT owners repay the loans and get their NFT back).
The credit scores of NFT owners, auction winners, bidders, and NFTs can be improved after auctions.

The auction mechanism for NFT can also be applied to any type of digital asset. In our road map, TRAVA.FINANCE will implement this auction feature for various types of digital assets (e.g., stock token, smart contract).

}]",,,"{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""##
A 
**Armoury** There are 4 NFTs (4 items), which can be assembled to complete a Knight: Helmet, Armor, Shield, and Weapon. Collecting 4 full items and assembling them, users will create a Trava Knight NFT.
**Armoury Chest** A Trava Armoury Chest contains one out of 4 Trava Knight NFT: Helmet; Armor, Shield and Weapon.
**Auction** Trava NFT Auction is a platform for NFT owners to sell their Knights by creating an Auction room and waiting for bidders to join and buy the Knights. Bidders can join any room and bid on the preferred Knights to become the owners of the Knights.
**Assembly** This is a function for users to combine 4 different kinds of NFT Armoury to create a complete NFT Knight. ##
B 
**Buy Order** Allows users to order Knights, Items they need on our NFT Marketplace."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/trava-knight-nft-glossary"", ""rrf_score"": 0.10795454545454546 }, { ""content"": ""#### 0.000554

_**Benefit of accessing various products and features in the Trava Ecosystem**_
All tickets of all kinds can be used to access these features.
_**Scenario 1. Applied in Trava Capital:**_ The ticket can be used to _**boost APR**_ _i_ n Trava Capital which will then increase your profit.
_**Scenario 2. Applied in Trava Lending:**_ By owning tickets, you can get much more benefits in Trava Lending, relating to Trava Governance, Trava Bridge, Fortune Mining Pool, and Auction as well as collateral. More specific, using tickets, you can: - Change time/balance lock in Trava Governance - Be allowed to implement multiple transactions in Trava Bridge - Borrow assets with Tickets as NFT-collateralized - Withdraw rewards in Governance earlier - Be able to put veTRAVA on the Auction/Sell/Buy program.
_**Scenario 3. Applied in Trava Knight NFT:**_ Take a look at the diagram that shows how you can apply for Tickets in the Trava Knight NFT programs. 
To be more specific, you can first buy tickets, then use them to exchange for chests. After opening your chests and getting armories, you can either exchange them on the NFT marketplace or continue collecting armories to assemble the Trava NFT Knight. Then, you have multiple options related to trading or to joining missions and minigames. The TRAVA and Incentive tickets you earn can be continuously used to get tickets, then repeatedly enjoy their utilities. And the circulation list goes on.
_To sum up, by owning tickets and optimizing them in various functions in the Trava Ecosystem, you can constantly get benefits thanks to the circular benefit model._

Last updated 1 year ago"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/nfts/trava-nft-ticket"", ""rrf_score"": 0.09401709401709402 }, { ""content"": ""NFT has become an increasingly popular way to buy and sell digital artwork. They are non-fungible, which naturally means that they are illiquid. Bringing liquidity to the NFT space would unlock a myriad of possibilities. As of May 2021, there have been no lending projects that make use of NFT as collaterals, because unlike a fungible currency or common stock, NFT value is difficult to determine. TRAVA.FINANCE adds more flexibility to the illiquid world of NFT and allows NFT owners to earn an ROI without selling it.
TRAVA.FINANCE offers an innovative feature that prices NFTs based on auctions. After the auction, borrowers can use their NFTs as collateral. TRAVA.FINANCE auction mechanism is divided into two modes: auction-to-sell and auction-for-buy-right. The difference between two modes is the ownership of the digital asset after the auction. In the auction-to-sell mode, as soon as the auction ends and the auction winner pays the fee, he/she will immediately receive the auctioned NFT. Meanwhile, in the auction-for-buy-right mode, the winner cannot immediately buy the digital asset. After a certain amount of time specified in the auction, if the NFT owners cannot repay the loan, the auction winner can buy it at a low price. Otherwise, they get a considerable interest if the NFT owners repay the loan and get their NFT back.
The auction process is as follows:
 1. The NFT owner opens an auction session; she sets (i) the legal crypto used in the auction, (ii) the initial price for her NFT, (iii) the countdown time for the auction session, (iv) the mode for her auction (i.e., _auction-to-sell or auction-for-buy-right_), and other auction terms.
 2. TRAVA.FINANCE users, who are interested in the NFT, can join in the auction session. To encourage users to participate in auctions, at the end of the auction, TRAVA.FINANCE randomly selects several bidders and rewards them with TRAVA tokens extracted from the auction fees. To guarantee that the bidders make their payment when they win the auction, TRAVA.FINANCE locks a number of their TRAVA tokens as soon as they join in the auction session and make a bid. When the auction finishes, they will immediately get their tokens back if they are not the winner. In case they are the winners, they can get their tokens back only if they pay for the auctioning NFT before the deadline.
 3. In the _auction-to-sell_ mode, the auction winner will pay the owner the whole auction price to get the NFT.
 4. In the _auction-for-buy-right_ mode, the auction winners have to pay a part of the auction price. We name the quotient of the amount the winners have to pay over the auction price ""_auction-paid ratio_ ‚Äù. The auction-paid ratio is calculated from the creditworthiness of the lender, borrower, NFT, and the auction terms. The NFT owners can use the cryptos paid by the auction winner as collateral for their loans. Once they repay their loan including the interest to the auction winners, they can get the NFT back. Otherwise, they will lose their NFT to the auction winners. These rules are all defined in the auction smart contract.


TRAVA.FINANCE provides benefits for all participants as described below.
 * **NFT owners** can determine their NFT value based on the bid prices given by the auction participants. The value can be much greater than their initial expectation. They can either directly sell their NFT or use their NFT as collateral and earn profit without losing it. TRAVA.FINANCE thus increases the liquidity of NFTs and opens up a unique and exciting NFTFi marketplace.
 * Based on the given number of auction bids, **bidders** have a corresponding chance to win the reward at the end of the auction session. This rewarding mechanism provides incentives for users to actively make a bid in the auction.
 * **Auction winners** can get their desired NFT at a price lower than their bidding price (once NFT owners cannot repay the loan) or they can receive considerable interest from their loan to NFT owners (once NFT owners repay the loans and get their NFT back).
 * The credit scores of **NFT owners, auction winners, bidders,** and **NFTs** can be improved after auctions.


The auction mechanism for NFT can also be applied to any type of digital asset. In our road map, TRAVA.FINANCE will implement this auction feature for various types of digital assets (e.g., stock token, smart contract).
