Was this helpful?"", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/whitepaper/collateralized-nfts"", ""rrf_score"": 0.08333333333333333 }, { ""content"": ""##
**Rules**
 1. **Auction is ONLY cancellable when it has NO BIDS.** After the first bid comes in, neither you nor we can cancel it, as rules are written in the smart contract.
 2. When the bidding countdown is less than **5 minutes left** , every new bid will extend the countdown **by 5 minutes** ;
 3. Each bid price will be increased by **at least 5%** of the previous one. Once the countdown ends, the auction item will be obtained by the last/highest bidder;
 4. The most important rule: **2.5%** of the price increase for each bid is distributed to the previous bidder, and the remaining **97.5%** would be the income of the auction publisher if it‚Äôs the last bid or returned to the bidder when it‚Äôs outbid.


With the rules, each bidder would either take the 5% share of the next bid or obtain the auction Knight with the price he/she offered. And the first bidder will additionally be free from distributing his/her own 5% to other people.
_Note: The percentage that the later bidder pays for the earlier bidder is the same as the percentage that the sellers need to pay for the platform. So, 2.5% is also the amount auction publishers pay to the marketplace, which means that after receiving 97.5% of the final bidding price as income, sellers need to pay 2.5% of the income to the NFT marketplace._
_Therefore, the final payment rate that the sellers receive is 95.06% of the final bid. This fee is utilized for marketing, operating, and functioning._
**Seller (Auction Publishers)**
**First Bidders**
**Other Bidders**
**Last Bidder**
**Receive:** ~95.06% of the final bidding price
**Receive:**
 * 100% of his/her bidding capital
 * 2,5% of the later bidding price


**Receive:**
 * 2.5% of the later bidding price
 * 97.5% of his/her bidding capital


**Pay:** the final bidding price
 _For example,_
 * First, Alice offered a 1000 TRAVA bid in a new auction.
 * Secondly, Billy offered 1100 TRAVA


‚áí Alice would receive her own 1000 TRAVA and 2.5% of 1100 TRAVA, which would be 1027.5 TRAVA in total, and the extra 27.5 TRAVA is totally free money.
 * Finally, Michael offered 1200 TRAVA.


‚áí Then, Billy would get 97.5% of his 1100 TRAVA and 2.5% of 1200 TRAVA, that is 1102.5 TRAVA, still getting 30 TRAVA for free.
‚áí The auction publisher will receive ~ 95.06% of the final bidding price (1200 TRAVA). Therefore, the seller will receive ~ 1140.72 TRAVA and pay 29.25 TRAVA to the platform. ##
**Steps to start an auction on Trava marketplace**
 _Step 1:_
 * Go to: https://nft-app.trava.finance/
 * Choose the Knight you want to sell in your NFT profile;


_Step 2:_ Set a start price and end time
**Note that the time range for an auction is from 1 - 7 days.**
_Step 3:_
 * Confirm in your wallet, then the auction will start immediately.
 * Once the auction is ended with bids, the seller or winning bidder needs to visit the Trava Knight auction tab and click the ‚Äú**Claim** ‚Äù button to finish the exchange transaction

Opening an auction allows auction publishers to set up their price floor for their Knights, which determines their minimum desired price, helping them avoid selling their Knights at an unwanted low price compared to the market price. The auction opens a great opportunity for Knight owners to make profits without the need of disassembling their Knights to pieces and selling each item multiple times, which can cause wasted gas fees due to multiple transactions. Benefit for bidders Trava Knight auction is of benefit for bidders since it offers them the opportunity to get the full Knight, not every piece of armoury NFT on Trava NFT Marketplace. This helps bidders save more time in obtaining a Knight without finding and collecting armoury items to assemble. The auction also offers bidders an excellent method to get their favorable Knights, which suits their needs for missions such as Farming, Expedition, Farming with EXP and PvP tournaments in the future. Benefit for Trava Lending Pool The NFT Auction is the first step toward Trava Finance‚Äôs long-term aim of allowing NFTs to be used as collateral in the Trava Lending pool. By using an auction mechanism, the NFT will be priced and subsequently used as collateral in the Trava loan pool. This is a good method to vary the collaterals and give users more opportunities to lend assets. Users can assemble Knight NFTs to join Trava Farming Programs (NFT Farming, Heuristic Farming) in different vaults for a great APY ‚Äî the rarer the NFT, the higher APY. The longer staked in the vaults, Loyal Knight NFT holders will also have more benefits in our lending pool in the future. content"": ""Trava Armoury Chest gives users the chance to receive an NFT, which is called Trava Armoury NFT. Those NFTs are four parts which constitute a Knight‚Äôs Armor set: Helmet, Armor, Shield and Weapon. Trava Armoury NFTs will be available in 5 rarities: Copper, Silver, Gold, Diamond and Crystal.

In this early stage, 200 chests will be given away to our first Knights in our ‚ÄúBe a Trava Holy Knight ‚Äî Join the Order‚Äù Campaign, 600 chests will be sold in our Flash Sales Program. After our first Giveaway and Flash Sales Program, more chests will be issued and sold on our official site.
In those available chests, the drop rates of NFTs are:

There will be three options to buy Trava Armoury Chest, users can buy one chest, a set of five chests, or a set of ten chests. Each Chest will be sold at 2000 $TRAVA in this early stage. The combo of 5 chests will be sold at a 2% discount, which means the price for 5 chests is 9800 $TRAVA. The combo of 10 will be discounted 5%, making the total price for 10 chests 19,000 $TRAVA.

Note that each wallet can only own a maximum of 50 Trava Armoury NFTs (50 items, including unopened Armoury Chests) at any given time. The number of Trava Knight NFTs that a wallet can hold is unlimited. Assembling a complete set of 4 Trava Armoury NFTs will result in a Trava Knight NFT.

### Key Details:
- **Initial Distribution**: 
 - 200 chests will be given away in the ""Be a Trava Holy Knight ‚Äî Join the Order"" campaign.
 - An additional 600 chests will be available for purchase during the Flash Sales Program.

- **Drop Rates**:
 - **Copper**: 60%
 - **Silver**: 25%
 - **Gold**: 10%
 - **Diamond**: 4.5%
 - **Crystal**: 0.5%

### Collection and Assembly:
Each wallet can hold **up to 50 Trava Armoury NFTs**. To create a Trava Knight NFT, a user must collect all four parts of the armor set. 

For more detailed information, you can check out their [official documents](https://blog.trava.finance/nfts/trava-armoury-chest).

column1: Would you like to explore a specific NFT, see current floor prices, or evaluate whether an NFT is good for collateral? I can help you with that.","docs, blog","[{""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/nfts/trava-nft-marketplace"",
content"": ""We implemented a NFT marketplace to give users a platform to exchange Knights, Items, etc. Preliminary process:
Sellers: list their Trava Armoury NFTs and Knight NFTs on our Marketplace.
Buyers: buy item(s) at a price listed by the seller.
We implemented a new feature that allows users to order Knights, Items they need on our NFT Marketplace with simple steps:
Going to NFT Marketplace (Buy Order section)
Creating a purchase order with specific features: Rarity, Type, Exp point, Price,v.v)
The prices must be set at a fixed price
EXP is at the lowest point that the buyers accept to buy
Put in the Price and EXP

Trava NFT Marketplace allows NFT owners to list and sell their NFTs. At the first stage, we will start to run the ‚ÄúTRAVA ARMOURY CHESTS ‚Äò‚Äô product, which allows users to buy and uncover mystery chests. Based on the Epic of Trava Knights, the item in those chests will be randomly 1 out of 4 parts of a knight‚Äôs armor, including: Helmet, Armor, Shield, and Weapon. These parts will be classified into 5 rarities from lowest to highest: Copper, Silver, Gold, Diamond, and Crystal. One chest will contain one item of random rarity. Users can assemble a special Collection NFT to farm in our NFT vault after collecting 4 full parts of Helmet, Armor, Shield, and Weapon.

,What is EXP points and how to earn them?,,"In Trava Finance, EXP points (Experience Points) are a gamified reward system tied to your Trava Knight NFTs. These points track your activity and progression within the ecosystem and are used to level up your Knights, unlock new abilities, boost staking rewards, or gain competitive advantages in quests or ranking events.
üéØ Purpose of EXP Points in Trava

column2: EXP helps your Trava Knight level up over time
Higher-level Knights may get better stats in future games or quests
Knights with more EXP might boost APY or staking rewards
EXP can influence your position in leaderboards or special events
Certain levels may unlock exclusive items, roles, or NFTs

column1: You earn EXP by actively engaging with the Trava ecosystem ‚Äî especially when using or equipping Trava Knight NFTs.

column3: Stake your Knight NFT in Trava‚Äôs staking or loyalty pool
Earn EXP over time as long as it‚Äôs staked
Some pools offer EXP bonuses during events or seasons
Join community quests, missions, or campaigns hosted on Trava
These might include:
Lending/borrowing a certain amount
Using Trava features like transmutation
Participating in governance votes

column1: ‚úÖ 3. Participating in NFT Auctions or Events

column3: Bidding or winning auctions (e.g., Armoury or Knight sales)
Can result in one-time EXP bonuses
Equipping NFTs from Armoury Chests may generate passive EXP or increase your EXP earning rate
Stronger or rarer items might give bonuses
Voting in DAO proposals (if eligible)
Being active in strategic decisions may offer EXP during reward rounds
EXP is tied to your Trava Knight NFT, not your wallet
You can view your Knight‚Äôs EXP level directly from:
https://app.trava.finance
‚ÄúMy NFTs‚Äù or ‚ÄúKnight Inventory‚Äù section

column1: üîÑ EXP points accumulate over time ‚Äî and may also decay if left unused in some seasonal systems.

Levels up Knights, boosts rewards, enables GameFi features

column1: Would you like to see how to stake your Knight and start earning EXP today, or simulate how long it would take to level up based on your Knight rarity and staking pool? I can walk you through it.",docs,"[{""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/nfts/exp-points"",

At the moment, EXP (Experience Point) is the point that shows how long an Armoury NFT is staked in our vaults. EXP is the parameter indicating the loyalty of NFT owners in our Farming Program. In the near future, EXP will be calculated in various ways apart from the length that NFT is farmed in our vault.

Currently, EXP of each Armoury NFT will increase when their owner assembles them to a Knight NFT and deposits Knight NFT in one of five vaults to farm. For every second of the Knight NFT in the vaults, EXP is added by 1. Therefore, after 1 hour EXP will increase by 3600 points. And the EXP will remain the same if it is withdrawn out of the vault
We‚Äôve already calculated EXPs for your NFTs at the time of opening the Farming Program. EXP in a collection (Trava Knight NFT) will be averaged based on the EXP of 4 Armoury NFTs (items).
You can see your EXP  either in the Inventory tab, Collection section or on Trava NFT Marketplace.

Normally, when you open chests to gain Armoury NFTs and assemble them into a Knight NFT. You farm your Knight NFT in our vault, all those Armoury NFTs are given the same EXPs. However, when you withdraw your Knight NFT, disassemble and reassemble with different items to get another Knight NFT, your Armoury NFTs will have different EXPs.

,What is Dilution Staking and its requirements ?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, Dilution Staking is a special staking mechanism designed to reduce the circulating supply of TRAVA tokens while offering rewards to long-term holders. It is part of Trava‚Äôs tokenomics and governance strategy, encouraging users to lock up their TRAVA in exchange for ecosystem benefits.
Dilution Staking is a form of long-term, locked staking where users commit TRAVA tokens for a fixed period and receive:

column3: Governance power (veTRAVA)
Staking rewards
Protection against token dilution (i.e., reduced influence from newly unlocked tokens)

column2: Helps support TRAVA token price stability
Locked tokens grant veTRAVA for voting rights
You must hold TRAVA to participate
You choose a fixed staking duration (e.g., 3 months to 4 years)
Tokens are non-withdrawable until the end of the period
Based on amount and duration, you receive veTRAVA (vote-escrowed TRAVA)

column1: The longer the lock-up, the more veTRAVA you receive, increasing your governance influence and staking rewards.
üìà What You Get from Dilution Staking

column2: Vote in governance proposals and DAO initiatives
Earn yield from protocol revenues or emissions
Maintain influence as token supply inflates

column3: Go to Trava Station
Navigate to ‚ÄúStaking ‚Üí Dilution Staking‚Äù
Connect your wallet (on BNB Chain)
Choose:
Amount of TRAVA to stake
Lock-up duration
Confirm the transaction ‚Üí You receive veTRAVA
You cannot withdraw early
Your veTRAVA decays over time until the unlock date
You can re-stake or extend the lock to maintain your veTRAVA level

column1: Would you like a calculator to estimate how much veTRAVA you‚Äôd receive based on your TRAVA amount and lock time?","Dilution Staking is a unique staking mechanism within the Trava Finance ecosystem that allows users to stake their Trava Knight NFTs to earn TRAVA token rewards and EXP (Experience Points) over time. What makes it different is the ‚Äúdilution‚Äù factor ‚Äî your share of rewards depends not only on your stake, but also on how many other users are staking at the same time.
It‚Äôs a staking pool designed to:

column2: Knight holders earn TRAVA tokens for staking their NFTs
Knights also gain EXP to level up
The more Knights staked, the less each one earns proportionally
Staking early or for longer periods offers better relative returns

column3: The reward pool is fixed per period (e.g., weekly or monthly)

Early staking

""content"": ""This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.
 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Requirements
To be able to participate in Dilution Staking, you must have the following:
  * TRAVA tokens to stake
  * Trava Knights: - Knight NFTs V2 - Limited Knight


**Note!!** Knights V1 will not be accepted, so please Trade-up them or buy Armoury Chests V2 and assemble your Knights.
 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Mechanism
 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Mechanism

Knight Rarities
Each Knight of a rarity has a different power rating, and maximum amount TRAVA to join a Limited Knight Battlefield.

 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Mechanism

 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Mechanism

Lock time
The longer the lock time, the higher the dilution percentage will be.
**Time Lock**
**Dilution**
6 Months

 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Mechanism

Retention rate
It will be calculated according to the ratio of TRAVA deposit to the amount of TRAVA circulating in the market. So when you deposit your TRAVA, all stakes will be snapshotted, ensuring your benefits are fixed at the moment of entry.
For example, if a user deposits 1 million TRAVA and the total amount of TRAVA in circulation at the moment is 1 billion, then the retention rate will be 0.1%.
 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Mechanism

Actions
  * Users can only deposit the first time.
  * During the locking period, users can extend the lock time for the NFTs.


 This is a form of Knight NFT and TRAVA staking, aiming to reduce the impact of inflation on long-term holders in the ecosystem.


Utilities
  * Protect long-term holders in the community against inflation, by lowering the risks when the price of TRAVA decreases.
  * Stake rights can be exchanged like NFTs.
  * Proof of stake can be sold on Trava Marketplace.

* ## Announcements 
Updates on the products from Trava Ecosystem.
2 Topics

**1. Idea** At the bear market, Trava Team focuses on building more features and products to expand the Trava Ecosystem. For example, to better manage Trava Lending Pool, Trava Finance has launched Governance.
However, we'd also love to hear more from Trava Knights, and see the different perspectives on the flow of ideas. So with the ultimate goal of building a robust and diverse Lending protocol, we decided to start this Idea Contest.
**2. Discussion** Raise your idea for developing products in Trava Finance's ecosystem:
Trava Lending Pool Trava Capital Trava Knight NFT 
Remember that Trava is Decentralized, so your ideas do not have to be limited to the above, or any technology, community or country. We'll listen to everyone's opinions, sifting through ideas from varying degrees of plausibility.
Ultimately, the development of these services/products is entirely decided by Trava Knights, through a process of discussion and voting. With each idea, the Trava Team will be in charge of evaluation and debate to build the best finalists.
The contributions from the Trava community will be a huge strength for the Trava Finance ecosystem.
**3. Execution** All you have to do is create a Topic with #IdeaContest in the title, state your idea and submit it to Trava Forum in any categories of the three: Trava Lending Pool, Knight NFT and Trava Capital.
We will be accepting your ideas **until 10 A.M. UTC on May 5, 2023.**
After that, a voting snapshot will be opened, then the best ideas selected for implementation will be rewarded with 500,000 TRAVA.
Raise your idea now to build up our ecosystem together!

**How to do when the site does not load?**
The following steps may solve your problems:
 * If you are using Google browser, switch to another browser to see if the issues are coming from the browser. If it is related to google browser some helpful actions are:
 * Clearing cache data and cookies for the site
 * Hard refresh with control + F5 (or cmd + r)
 * Disable brave wallet (or the wallet not being used as default, for example metamask, dapper, etc.)or other extensions that might be interfering with proper connection with the wallet
 * If the site still won't load after taking the steps above, you will have to use the platform in another browser.
 * Make sure your internet connection is working and stable
 * Restart the browser and try to connect again
 * Try to hard refresh the site with control + F5
 * Check if there are any updates for your browser or wallet provider. If so, update it to the latest version."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/faq/troubleshooting"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""##

,What are the features of Trava Finance?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, Trava Finance is a comprehensive decentralized finance (DeFi) platform that combines lending, credit scoring, NFTs, and GameFi to build a flexible and modular financial ecosystem. Below are the core features of Trava Finance:

column3: Supply and borrow crypto assets in a trustless manner.
Supports multiple asset types (e.g., BUSD, USDT, TRAVA, etc.).
Dynamic interest rates based on pool utilization.
Unique to Trava: any user can create their own lending pool.
Set parameters like:
Supported tokens
Interest models
Collateral factors
Liquidation rules
Enables niche or community-specific lending markets.
Assigns a credit score to each wallet based on:
Repayment behavior
Collateral usage
Protocol engagement
Supports future under-collateralized lending and personalized loan terms.
A dedicated system to buy liquidated collateral at a discount.
Open to anyone, incentivizing liquidation of risky positions and maintaining pool health.
Trava Knight NFTs: Collectible characters with stats and rarity.
Armoury Chest: Loot boxes containing in-game items (e.g., weapons, armor).
Transmutation: Fuse items to create upgraded gear.
Planned PvP/PvE battle system using NFTs.
Buy/sell Trava Knight NFTs and gear.
View item stats, rarity, and listings.
Supports auctions and fixed-price sales.
Combine lower-tier Armoury items into more powerful ones.
Used to enhance gameplay or increase NFT value.
Stake TRAVA tokens with time locks to:
Earn rewards
Gain veTRAVA (vote-escrowed TRAVA)
Increase governance power and reduce dilution
TRAVA token holders vote on:
Protocol upgrades
Parameter changes
Community proposals
Initially launched on BNB Chain.
Designed for cross-chain expansion and interoperability.

column2: Launch custom lending pools with tailored rules
On-chain scoring system for borrower trust
Trade NFTs and items within the ecosystem
Fuse items to create higher-tier gear
Lock TRAVA tokens to earn veTRAVA and rewards
Participate in liquidations for profit and risk control

column1: Would you like help comparing Trava‚Äôs features with another protocol like Aave or Venus?","Trava Finance is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol with a focus on flexible lending, NFT utility, AI-based risk management, and multi-pool customization. It goes beyond traditional lending platforms like Aave or Compound by offering a modular, user-driven ecosystem. Here‚Äôs a full breakdown of its standout features:

column3: Supply and borrow a wide range of crypto assets
Choose from default pools or custom user-created pools
Earn interest as a lender or access capital as a borrower
Anyone can create a lending pool with:
Custom interest rate models
Supported tokens
Risk thresholds (LTV, liquidation)
Suitable for DAOs, games, or niche DeFi apps
Advanced tools evaluate:
Borrower behavior
Collateral volatility
NFT value and liquidity
Used to adjust lending limits and pool security
Use NFTs (e.g., Trava Knights) to borrow crypto
NFT risk and floor value assessed by Trava‚Äôs valuation engine
Supports Trava-native and partner NFTs
Buy/sell:
Knight NFTs
Armoury Chest items
Integrated with staking, transmutation, and GameFi utility
Combine low-rarity NFT equipment into higher-tier NFTs
Burn + evolve = stronger items for staking or resale
Stake Knight NFTs to earn TRAVA tokens and EXP
Rewards are diluted as more users stake ‚Äî rewarding early or rare NFT holders
Earn EXP points through staking and activity
Level up Knights to increase yield and future gameplay strength
Vote on protocol upgrades, pool policies, and ecosystem grants
TRAVA is the native utility + governance token
Built on BNB Chain, with plans for Ethereum and other EVM chains
Accessible via MetaMask, Trust Wallet, WalletConnect

column2: Track borrower risk, pool health, and collateral status
Loot-box style drops of equipment NFTs
Bid on NFTs and rare items using TRAVA or BNB
Auto-liquidates risky positions to protect pool solvency
Build your own DeFi frontends or integrate Trava tools

column1: üîë Summary: What Makes Trava Finance Unique

column1: Let me know if you‚Äôd like to explore a specific feature live, like pool creation, NFT staking, or checking current APYs. I can walk you through it.",docs,"[{""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/whitepaper"",
content"": ""There are six salient features of TRAVA.FINANCE, including:

Crypto lending marketplace: TRAVA.FINANCE creates a marketplace in which anyone confident in their abundant capital and profound knowledge of finance is free to create and manage their own lending pools. This multiple-pool model allows pool owners and their pool members to flexibly adapt their investment strategies to the volatility of the crypto market and obtain greater earnings.

Semantic knowledge graph: TRAVA.FINANCE is built upon the semantic cross-chain knowledge graph. The graph is a distributed ledger that holds the data collected from multiple blockchain networks in the form of entities and their interconnections. The graph allows TRAVA.FINANCE to efficiently search for useful information such as (i) the amount and value of assets exchanged between two wallet addresses; (ii) the provenance of an NFT; (iii) aggregated assets of the same user on multiple networks, etc.

Data analysis: To reduce lending risks, TRAVA.FINANCE performs statistical data analysis based on the cross-chain knowledge graph and other data sources. TRAVA.FINANCE recommends the optimal parameters for pool owners to create and maintain their own pools (e.g., borrowing-lending interest rate, Loan to Value ratio, liquidation threshold, a minimum credit score of borrowers). TRAVA.FINANCE also assists them in detecting and alerting unusual transactions in their pools.

Credit score evaluation: Though being an effective tool in lending, credit score has never been used in existing decentralized lending platforms. As a pioneer, TRAVA.FINANCE uses the cross-chain knowledge graph to evaluate credit scores for users and their digital assets. The pool owners thus can (i) reduce the lending risks by defining a credit-score threshold for borrowers participating in the lending pool; and (ii) stimulate borrowing by defining a high Loan to Value ratio for borrowers with high credit scores.

Cross-chain identification and cross-chain lending: TRAVA.FINANCE uses the cross-chain identification protocol to identify all wallet addresses of the same users on different networks. After that, users can use up all of their cryptos as collateral for a huge loan in a single transaction. This facilitates their borrowing operations and saves them transaction fees. Cross- chain identification also helps them to increase their credit scores.

NFT, stock tokens, and other digital assets as collaterals: To increase the liquidity of such special assets as NFT, stock tokens, or smart contracts, TRAVA.FINANCE allows users to use all of these asset types as collaterals. Before that, the special digital assets must be priced through auctions. The auction winners are involved in the lending contract. They can either possess the digital asset at a low price or earn considerable amounts from the contract.

""content"": ""Figure 1: Main features of TRAVA.FINANCE
TRAVA.FINANCE (or TRAVA) is the world‚Äôs first decentralized marketplace for cross-chain lending. While existing approaches provide only one or a few lending pools with their own parameters such as borrowing/lending interest rate, liquidity threshold, Loan to Value ratio, or a limited list of exchangeable cryptocurrencies, TRAVA.FINANCE offers a flexible mechanism in which users can create and manage their own lending pools to start a lending business. TRAVA.FINANCE is deployed on the Binance Smart Chain and allows for lending with BSC tokens first; we then enable cross-chain lending with various tokens on Ethereum and other blockchain networks.
The pool owners, who are an additional role to lenders and borrowers, can receive more earnings by devising a good lending strategy for their pools. Moreover, to reduce risks and stimulate lending and borrowing, TRAVA.FINANCE performs cross-chain data analysis on multiple blockchain networks to (i) recommend optimal pool parameters for pool owners and (ii) detect unusual transactions in their pools. The lending marketplace model of TRAVA.FINANCE will increase crypto liquidity and promote the growth of the DeFi ecosystem. There are six salient features of TRAVA.FINANCE, including:
  * **Crypto lending marketplace** : TRAVA.FINANCE creates a **marketplace** in which anyone confident in their abundant capital and profound knowledge of finance is free to create and manage their own lending pools. This multiple-pool model allows pool owners and their pool members to flexibly adapt their investment strategies to the volatility of the crypto market and obtain greater earnings.
  * **Semantic knowledge graph** : TRAVA.FINANCE is built upon the semantic cross-chain knowledge graph. The graph is a distributed ledger that holds the data collected from multiple blockchain networks in the form of entities and their interconnections. The graph allows TRAVA.FINANCE to efficiently search for useful information such as (i) the amount and value of assets exchanged between two wallet addresses; (ii) the provenance of an NFT; (iii) aggregated assets of the same user on multiple networks, etc.
  * **Data analysis** : To reduce lending risks, TRAVA.FINANCE performs statistical data analysis based on the cross-chain knowledge graph and other data sources. TRAVA.FINANCE recommends the optimal parameters for pool owners to create and maintain their own pools (e.g., borrowing-lending interest rate, Loan to Value ratio, liquidation threshold, a minimum credit score of borrowers). TRAVA.FINANCE also assists them in detecting and alerting unusual transactions in their pools.
  * **Credit score evaluation** : Though being an effective tool in lending, credit score has never been used in existing decentralized lending platforms. As a pioneer, TRAVA.FINANCE uses the cross-chain knowledge graph to evaluate credit scores for users and their digital assets. The pool owners thus can (i) reduce the lending risks by defining a credit-score threshold for borrowers participating in the lending pool; and (ii) stimulate borrowing by defining a high Loan to Value ratio for borrowers with high credit scores.
  * **Cross-chain identification and cross-chain lending** : TRAVA.FINANCE uses the cross-chain identification protocol to identify all wallet addresses of the same users on different networks. After that, users can use up all of their cryptos as collateral for a huge loan in a single transaction. This facilitates their borrowing operations and saves them transaction fees. Cross- chain identification also helps them to increase their credit scores.
  * **NFT, stock tokens, and other digital assets as collaterals** : To increase the liquidity of such special assets as NFT, stock tokens, or smart contracts, TRAVA.FINANCE allows users to use all of these asset types as collaterals. Before that, the special digital assets must be priced through auctions. The auction winners are involved in the lending contract. They can either possess the digital asset at a low price or earn considerable amounts from the contract.

,What is Trava's architecture?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, Trava‚Äôs architecture is designed as a modular, scalable, and decentralized ecosystem that combines DeFi, NFT, and GameFi components into a cohesive multi-functional platform.
Trava‚Äôs architecture is built on three core layers:
This layer includes the smart contracts and blockchain base that power Trava‚Äôs decentralized services.

column3: Deployed on BNB Chain (with cross-chain plans)
Core smart contracts manage:
Lending pools
Collateralization
Interest calculations
Liquidation mechanics
NFT minting and ownership

column1: Smart contracts are open-source and verifiable for transparency.
This is the intelligent backend that handles user credit evaluation, automation, and risk management.

column3: Credit Scoring Engine: Uses on-chain data and ML models to rate user risk
Liquidation Engine: Detects undercollateralized loans and triggers liquidation events
Pool Factory Module: Enables custom pool creation with user-defined parameters
NFT/GameFi Services: Manage minting, transmutation, and item mechanics

column1: This is the user-facing front end provided through the Trava Station portal.

column3: Lending dashboard (supply, borrow, repay, withdraw)
Credit score viewer
NFT auction and marketplace
Armoury Chest and transmutation UI
Staking, governance, and pool management

column1: Built with modern Web3 tools like:

column3: Web3.js / Ethers.js
The Graph (for subgraph indexing)
WalletConnect, MetaMask support

column2: Customizable smart contracts for supplying and borrowing assets
ML-based scoring system that evaluates wallet trustworthiness
Manages minting, rarity, upgrades, and NFT metadata
Battle systems (PvP/PvE), gear usage, loot rewards
Trading engine for NFTs and game items
TRAVA token voting and proposal system
Monitors health factors, interest rate models, pool exposure

column3: Smart contracts are audited and use proxy/upgradable patterns.
Risk mitigation systems prevent overexposure and control liquidity drains.
User-controlled wallets ensure non-custodial access to funds and NFTs.

column1: [ Logic Layer: Credit Engine, Liquidator, Pool Factory ]

This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes & improvements as a way of participating in the protocol‚Äôs decision-making process.
In the big picture, there are four essential components in Trava Governance: the Trava community, the DAO Committee, the Security Advisory Board (SAB), and Governance Portal & smart contracts.
 * Trava community: The most valuable resource of ideas, discussions & feedback for protocol changes. Everyone can raise their voice & share their opinion on Trava Forum or any community social channels.
 * DAO Committee: The entrusted individuals in the Trava community to submit proposals after a thorough review with discussion & feedback.
 * Security Advisory Board: The guardian for the protocol‚Äôs security when some malicious actions are aimed at the protocol or in unexpected events.
 * Governance Portal & Smart contracts: The autonomous ‚ÄúHand of the King‚Äù consists of governance contracts for on-chain voting and multiple timelocks governing and automating the changes & updates of Trava Ecosystem‚Äôs smart contracts. That keeps the governance process public and transparent to everyone.

,How does TRAVA.FINANCE incentivize validators to update the knowledge graph?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, validators are incentivized to update the knowledge graph through a reward mechanism that compensates them with TRAVA tokens for their contributions to the ecosystem.
üîç What Is the Knowledge Graph in Trava?
The Knowledge Graph is a dynamic data structure within the Trava protocol that represents:

column3: Relationships between user addresses
On-chain behaviors
Risk profiles and credit-related data

column1: It is a core part of Trava‚Äôs credit scoring and risk evaluation engine, especially as the platform expands its DeFi + GameFi intelligence.

column3: Validators who accurately and timely update the knowledge graph receive TRAVA token rewards.
This ensures the graph remains up-to-date, improving credit scoring and risk prediction accuracy.
Rewards may be weighted by the quality or importance of the updates:
More accurate or high-impact updates = higher rewards
Spam or low-quality contributions may be ignored or penalized
The system is designed to allow multiple validators to contribute in a permissionless or delegated model.
Over time, this supports decentralized intelligence building across the Trava ecosystem.
Validators may be required to stake TRAVA to participate, ensuring they have skin in the game.
False or manipulative updates may result in penalties or slashing (if staking is used).

column2: Update and maintain knowledge graph accuracy
Performance and integrity affect reward levels
May be required to discourage malicious updates

column1: Would you like help modeling how this validator system could be integrated into a dApp, or see how knowledge graph data impacts a user‚Äôs credit score?","As of now, Trava Finance does not operate a blockchain or network that uses validators in the traditional proof-of-stake sense, nor does it directly utilize a knowledge graph maintained by validators in the way that some semantic or oracle-based projects (like The Graph or Chainlink) might.

However, if your question refers to how Trava might incentivize participants (oracles, evaluators, or off-chain agents) to update or contribute to risk models, NFT valuations, or pool intelligence, then here‚Äôs how Trava encourages decentralized data contribution and accuracy:
Trava uses AI models and potentially third-party valuation oracles to:

column3: Appraise NFT values for collateral use
Assess borrower risk profiles
Recalculate pool-level risk in real time

column1: While not called ‚Äúvalidators,‚Äù Trava may rely on:

column3: External data sources
Community-voted mechanisms for approving valuation models or risk scoring methods

column1: Incentives may include TRAVA token rewards, or governance voting rights for those who maintain accurate data inputs or improve models.
TRAVA token holders play a validator-like role in:

column3: Proposing or voting on how pools are managed
Approving new token listings or collateral settings
Suggesting upgrades to the NFT valuation algorithm or rules

column1: Governance participants are incentivized through staking and voting rewards. This aligns their incentives with accurate, decentralized decision-making ‚Äî similar to how ‚Äúvalidators‚Äù ensure trust in a network.
In the NFT and staking ecosystem:

column3: Users who stake Knights, complete quests, or contribute to ecosystem activities earn EXP points, item drops, or TRAVA rewards.
Some of these actions may indirectly support knowledge updates (e.g., transmuting or auctioning NFTs helps define their true value).

column1: üìç To Clarify: No Native Knowledge Graph Validators

column3: Trava does not use a validator network to maintain a decentralized knowledge graph like The Graph Protocol.

AI model integration

content"": ""Validators must update the knowledge graph regularly, otherwise, they will be stripped of their validator role, and cannot earn rewards for appending new blocks or verifying transactions.‚Äù

‚ÄúEach time enriching the knowledge graph, validators will gain the fame score, thereby gaining more priorities and indirectly having the opportunity to earn more TRAVA.FINANCE coins when joining the network.‚Äù
‚ÄúPriorities may include voting power or the privilege to unlock TRAVA.FINANCE tokens earlier than the standard time when receiving awards.

""content"": ""Figure 3: An example of the cross-chain knowledge graph
The knowledge graph is one of the most fundamental components of TRAVA.FINANCE, which is responsible for storing and representing aggregated data from multiple blockchain networks. The graph and TRAVA.FINANCE protocols make independent blockchains interconnected and create the internet of hyper-linked blockchains, allowing DApps to address complex business in reality.
Figure 3 shows an example of the knowledge graph. The circle represents an entity (or instance) of data such as a wallet address, a user, a lending pool, an NFT, or other types of digital assets. Each entity is associated with other entities in certain relationships, represented by directional arrows; the direction of an arrow is the direction of the relationship.
The white rectangles are the values for the data attributes of the entity. The example graph shows that the WalletAddress2 is on the Ethereum network and that address owns an NFT. Aggregated information of the NFT, such as the highest bid price, number of auctions, list of addresses ever owned, etc., are also represented in the knowledge graph.
Let us assume that a user creates one address on the Bitcoin network and one address on the Ethereum network. Because there were no relationships among these addresses, the knowledge graph creates two anonymous users, i.e., AnonymousUser1 and AnonymousUser2. AnonymousUser1 owns the Bitcoin addresses (i.e., WalletAddress3), and AnonymousUser2 has one Ethereum address, i.e., WalletAddress1. Various information related to a wallet address is stored in the graph. For example, the WalletAddress3 entity contains the _average balance_ , the _total amount of ETHs transferred in and out_ , the _total number of transactions_ , or _the average, median, mode,_ and _highest number of ETHs transferred in one transaction._
Assuming the user wants to increase his/her credit score or use up all of his/her cryptos as collateral for a loan, he or she can unify all addresses as one via the cross-chain identification protocol performed in only one TRAVA.FINANCE's transaction. After completing the transaction, the two anonymous users are linked by the _sameAs_ relationship.
Depending on users‚Äô needs, the cross-chain identification protocol also supports linking two wallet address entities by a _guarantee_ relationship. Once an address is lost, if all the addresses that guarantee the address confirm the loss, the address status will be claimed as _lost_ in the knowledge graph.
Wallet addresses can also be connected by a _transfer_ relationship. To ensure scalability, rather than detailed transactions, statistical and aggregated information on transactions is calculated and stored in that _transfer_ relationship. As in the knowledge graph example above, several remarkable pieces of information are saved, including _BlockchainAddress1 has transferred 400 ETHs in total to BlockchainAddress2; it is performed through 10 transactions, and the largest transaction transfers 200 ETHs._
To avoid junk addresses and junk digital assets, we do not store all blockchain entities in the knowledge graph. The number of transactions or the maximum of cryptos transferred in one transaction related to an NFT or an address needs to surpass a threshold so that the NFT and the address will be added to the knowledge graph. The knowledge graph can also represent other types of entities, relationships, and properties. We develop a unified interface so that the expansion of the knowledge graph can be done in a logical, consistent, effective, scalable, and standardized manner.
As the knowledge graph plays a crucial role, it can only be updated by a TRAVA.FINANCE‚Äôs validator, and this must be agreed upon by other validators on the network. The knowledge graph needs to be infinitely extended while the assigned number of TRAVA.FINANCEs is fixed and finite. Thus it is not possible to pay fees for updating the graph. However, there should also be a way to encourage validators to update and enrich the knowledge graph. To reconcile this contradiction, TRAVA.FINANCE requires and also encourages validators to update the knowledge graph.
On the one hand, validators must update the knowledge graph regularly, otherwise, they will be stripped of their validator role, and cannot earn rewards for appending new blocks or verifying transactions. On the other hand, each time enriching the knowledge graph, validators will gain the fame score, thereby gaining more priorities and indirectly having the opportunity to earn more TRAVA.FINANCE coins when joining the network.
Priorities may include voting power or the privilege to unlock TRAVA.FINANCE tokens earlier than the standard time when receiving awards. Enriching the graph is a special kind of TRAVA.FINANCE transaction that requires no fee. Out of all transactions, graph-related transactions are extracted and stored separately in files along with their hash value. This allows validators and other nodes to (re)construct the graph more efficiently with their own graph database systems.
PreviousArchitectureNextCross-chain Identification
Last updated 3 years ago

,What steps does a user need to take to prove ownership of multiple wallet addresses?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, if a user wants to prove ownership of multiple wallet addresses (for example, to unify their credit history or gain better scores in Trava‚Äôs credit system), they must complete a signature-based verification process across all wallets.
‚úÖ Steps to Prove Ownership of Multiple Wallet Addresses on Trava

This message typically contains a nonce and a link to your primary wallet address.

column1: Would you like a step-by-step interface walkthrough or a template message for wallet signature verification?","To prove ownership of multiple wallet addresses, a user must demonstrate that they control the private keys to each of those addresses. Make sure you have access to all wallets you want to prove ownership of. These can be:

Web3-enabled form on the Trava website

Recovered address from signature == Submitted address
If this holds true for all submitted addresses, you‚Äôve successfully proven ownership of all.

content"": ""To foster their DeFi transactions, they might need to prove that they are the owner of n addresses. To this end, they can use our wallet application to perform a transaction that activates the cross-chain identification protocol.‚Äù
‚ÄúUsers can add a new account to the wallet application in multiple ways, e.g., (i) create an account, (ii) import a private key, and (iii) connect to a hardware wallet.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe wallet uses the Merkle tree to hash the data and obtains the rootHash (32 bytes) rootHash := MerkleTree([data1,data2,data3]).getRoot().‚Äù
‚ÄúThe user then uses her 3 private keys to sign on the rootHash. Each signing creates a signature, named si (64 bytes).

}]",,,"{ ""number_of_documents"": 5, ""results"": [ { ""content"": ""Figure 4: Cross-chain identification
The cross-chain identification protocol plays an important role in the TRAVA.FINANCE architecture. It can be used to verify that multiple addresses on different chains belong to the same user. The protocol allows TRAVA.FINANCE to provide an overview of anonymous users, including their total cryptos and other digital assets, statistics for their transactions, and their relationships with other blockchain addresses. These types of information and relationships are stored on the cross-chain knowledge graph. The protocol can (i) improve the credit score of the users and their wallet address so that they can get favorable interest rates, (ii) save them transaction fees since they can use up all of their cryptos as collateral in a single transaction, and (iii) allow them to get their cryptos back when they lose one of their wallet address.
To implement the protocol, we develop a wallet application so that users can manage their accounts and prove their ownership of multiple accounts. The application provides users with two functionalities: _‚ÄúAdd account‚Äù_ and _‚ÄúCreate a proof of ownership‚Äù._ Users can add a new account to the wallet application in multiple ways, e.g., (i) create an account, (ii) import a private key, and (iii) connect to a hardware wallet.
To foster their DeFi transactions, they might need to prove that they are the owner of n addresses. To this end, they can use our wallet application to perform a transaction that activates the cross-chain identification protocol. Receiving the transaction, TRAVA validators check the accuracy of the data associated with the transaction. If the data is valid, the validators accept the transaction and write the **sameAs** relationship among the owners of the addresses to the knowledge graph.
In the following we describe our processing to verify the cross-chain identification of multiple wallet addresses. ####
User side
Assume that a user would like to confirm her ownership for 3 accounts, the wallet creates a message containing 3 data elements, each includes a pair of a _chainId_ and a _public key_. Every element has a fixed size of 41 bytes: 8 bytes for the _chainId_ and 33 bytes for the _public key_. The data format is as follows:
 * data1 (41 bytes) := chainId1 (8 bytes) + pub1 (33 bytes)
 * data2 (41 bytes) := chainId2 (8 bytes) + pub2 (33 bytes)
 * data3 (41 bytes) := chainId3 (8 bytes) + pub3 (33 bytes)


The wallet uses the Merkle tree to hash the data and obtains the _rootHash_ (32 bytes)
 * rootHash := MerkleTree([data1,data2,data3]).getRoot()


The user then uses her 3 private keys to sign on the _rootHash_. Each signing creates a signature, named _si_ (64 bytes):
 * s1 := Sign(rootHash, prv1)
 * s2 := Sign(rootHash, prv2)
 * s3 := Sign(rootHash, prv3)


Finally, a transaction is generated and broadcasted to validators. A sample of transaction payload is as follows:
 * Type (8 bytes): ""SameAs""
 * Number (4 bytes): 3 // The number of addresses
 * Message (n*41 bytes): data1 data2 data3
 * Signatures (n*64 bytes): s1 s2 s3
 * Timestamp (8 bytes): 1619602364


The total size of a transaction to prove n accounts of the same user is: _20 + n * 105_ bytes ####
Validator side
Receiving the transaction, TRAVA validators verify the timestamp and then verify the signatures as follows. They first extract the message _{data1, ‚Ä¶ datan}_ and the list of signatures _{s1, ‚Ä¶ sn}_. From each data element _datai_ , the validators get the _chainId_ and the _public key_ (i.e., _pubi_). They use the Merkle tree to hash the data and regenerate the _rootHash_ :
 * rootHash := MerkleTree([data1, data2, data3]).getRoot()


The validators then use _pubi_ to verify signature _si_ on the rootHash:
 * verifySignature(rootHash, s1 , pub1) => valid/invalid
 * verifySignature(rootHash, s2 , pub1) => valid/invalid
 * verifySignature(rootHash, s3 , pub1) => valid/invalid


Once all signatures are valid, the validators agree that all accounts stored in the message belong to the same user. From n pairs of _chainId_ and _public key_ , the validators calculate the respective addresses of the user. To eliminate useless addresses, the validators perform additional checks on the age of the address, its average balance, or the total number of transactions related to the address. Finally, the validators store the _sameAs_ relationship among the valid addresses of the user on the knowledge graph.
PreviousCross-chain Knowledge GraphNextCredit Score Evaluation
Last updated 3 years ago

Published in
4 min readSep 16, 2022
Share
Introduction to BRicher‚Äôs new functions
 _BRicher is a unique aggregator that composes multiple investment methods: providing liquidity, swapping, staking, depositing, and borrowing in the lending pools._
_In summary, these composite strategies are automatically built so that users can get the most optimized one to maximize their profit. Moreover, unlike other aggregators, BRicher lets investors own their tokens so that they can take complete control of capital and investment plans._ # The first version of BRicher
In the first version, BRicher provided users with effective investment strategies with high returns and helped them keep track of their diaries (ROI and other critical parameters).
_An investment strategy suggested by BRicher_
However, the problem is that after discovering their best investment suggestion, users need to implement all the investing processes by themself, which is significantly time-consuming. Additionally, some ‚Äúnewbies‚Äù unfamiliar with various DApps may find it challenging to accomplish complicated operations independently.
To address these problems and provide users with more optimized options, we would like to offer new functions: Auto Investing and Semi-auto Investing.
As their name ‚Äî ‚ÄúAuto‚Äù- these two new functions will automatically simplify the investment process and save investors much time. # Introduction to Semi-auto Investing function
 ## ** _What is the Semi-auto Investing function?_**
_Semi-auto Investing is a new feature that allows users to finish different stages of the investment strategies directly on the BRicher interface rather than on other DApps._
In more detail, recommended strategies usually consist of several steps, each with smaller operations. Performing all of these tasks in multiple DApps can be challenging and time-consuming.
In this case, the Semi-auto Investing function supports users effectively by allowing them to gradually execute the strategies on only one site ‚Äî BRicher. That means even though users still need to invest step by step, there will be one button for each stage on BRicher‚Äôs interface for them to click on and complete the process easier. ## **_What benefit does it bring to users?_**
* It is much more convenient than the Manual Investing feature, which requires users to access each DApps and execute the required steps.
 * Investors can control and keep track of each step of the investment implementation. That helps them to deeply understand the progress and, more importantly, make the modification in each step (cancel, for example) if necessary. # Introduction to Auto Investing function.
 ## **_What is the Auto Investing function?_**
Upgraded from Semi-auto Investing, the Auto investing function requires users nothing but to click one only button. By doing that, the user authorizes BRicher to fully automate every phase of the investing strategy. ## **_What benefits does it bring to users?_**
* The implementation of investment plans is made simpler by condensing complicated multi-step procedures into a single button.
 * Compared to Manual investing and Semi-auto Investing, this function saves considerable time and effort for users."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/introduction-to-bricher-auto-investing-and-semi-auto-investing-82037b50eb6b?source=collection_home_page----75e285c42203-----46-----------------------------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""####
Step 4. Confirm and finish creating the pool.
After setting all assets for your pool, click on ‚ÄúConfirm‚Äù in the under-left corner. 
Following the next requirements that are shown in the pop-up.
The pop-up shows that you created a new pool successfully with details of this pool: Name, Assets, and owner address."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/user-guide/trava-pool-creation-user-guide"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""# **Utilizing Smart Wallet in Trava Station system: Embracing the future**
Published in
4 min readAug 19, 2023
Share
As reported in the recent topic about Trava Station in the Forum, we have introduced you to some information about this new product. In it, we mentioned the need for a feature so that we can combine various actions in a single transaction ‚Äî Smart Wallet.
Utilizing Smart Wallet in Trava Station system
However, many people may not understand their fundamental mechanisms and profound benefits, and that is why we have this article. Follow along with the content below to answer questions surrounding Smart Wallet, and clarify the importance of it in the Trava Station system. # Unveiling the Smart Wallet
At its core, a smart wallet is an advanced digital tool designed to enhance the way we store, manage, and interact with our financial assets. Each smart wallet is created and owned by the user, representing them (their proxy) and ensuring absolute control over its operations.
Departing from the standard Web3 wallets, smart wallets eliminate the need for private keys or seed phrases, instead rely on smart contracts. These intricate computer programs run on a blockchain, operate based on predefined rules and conditions. Conditions and access permissions are encoded into these self-executing code, rendering Smart Wallet both secure and adaptable for managing financial resources."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/utilizing-smart-wallet-in-trava-station-system-embracing-the-future-b8b88004ff69?source=post_page---author_recirc--ebdcf476c1d6----3---------------------bed98f8b_d6b4_4145_991e_d2711613b2c4--------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.06470588235294118 }, { ""content"": ""##
A 
**Automatically invest** Automatically investing means that you only need to click one button, then all the investment steps will be implemented automatically. ##
C 
**Composite strategy** A combination of multiple investing methods, including providing liquidity, swapping, staking, depositing, and borrowing in the lending pools."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://docs.trava.finance/glossary/bricher-glossary"", ""rrf_score"": 0.0625 } ] }",True,True,True,True,FALSE,False,,,,['https://docs.trava.finance/whitepaper/cross-chain-knowledge-graph'],"['To foster their DeFi transactions, they might need to prove that they are the owner of n addresses. ,What are the four essential components of Trava Governance?,"According to the Trava Finance documentation, the four essential components of Trava Governance form the foundation of how the Trava protocol is managed, upgraded, and influenced by the community through a decentralized decision-making model.
üó≥Ô∏è The Four Essential Components of Trava Governance

column3: The native governance token of the Trava ecosystem.
Used for:
Voting on proposals
Participating in staking
Earning rewards
Holding TRAVA gives you a voice in shaping the protocol‚Äôs future.
Users lock TRAVA tokens for a set period to receive veTRAVA, which represents governance power.
The longer the lock, the more veTRAVA you get.
veTRAVA is used to:
Vote in governance decisions
Participate in protocol incentive distribution
Access dilution staking benefits
Community members or the core team can submit proposals to:
Change protocol parameters
Launch new pools or features
Adjust reward allocations
Integrate new assets
Proposals go through a voting process where veTRAVA holders decide the outcome.
All governance votes are conducted through veTRAVA-weighted voting.
The more veTRAVA you hold, the more voting power you have.
Voting is done on-chain via the Trava Station governance interface.

column2: Vote-escrowed TRAVA used for voting & rewards
On-chain voting based on veTRAVA holdings

column1: Would you like a guide on how to lock TRAVA to get veTRAVA, or how to submit and vote on a proposal step by step?","The four essential components of Trava Governance form the backbone of how decisions are proposed, evaluated, and implemented within the Trava Finance ecosystem. column3: Any TRAVA token holder (meeting a minimum threshold) can create proposals to:
Modify pool parameters
Add new features or assets
Adjust staking/yield mechanics
Allocate treasury funds
Must hold a minimum number of TRAVA tokens (or stake them)
Proposals include a description, action plan, and justification
TRAVA holders can vote on active proposals using their token weight.
Voting is typically proportional: 1 TRAVA = 1 vote
Some proposals may have:
Quorum thresholds (minimum votes to be valid)
Voting periods (e.g., 3‚Äì7 days)
Users stake TRAVA tokens to:
Gain voting power
Earn staking rewards
Access governance-exclusive privileges
Long-term stakers may earn higher voting multipliers
Encourages alignment between voters and protocol success
Once passed, proposals are:
Queued and executed via governance smart contracts
Implemented either automatically (on-chain) or manually (if off-chain action is needed)

column1: Execution is transparent, and proposal status can be tracked through the Trava Dashboard or DAO interface.

column2: Users submit ideas and changes via formal proposals
Token holders vote on proposals proportionally
TRAVA must be staked to gain governance power
Approved proposals are implemented through smart contracts

This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes & improvements as a way of participating in the protocol‚Äôs decision-making process.
In the big picture, there are four essential components in Trava Governance: the Trava community, the DAO Committee, the Security Advisory Board (SAB), and Governance Portal & smart contracts.
 * Trava community: The most valuable resource of ideas, discussions & feedback for protocol changes. Everyone can raise their voice & share their opinion on Trava Forum or any community social channels.
 * DAO Committee: The entrusted individuals in the Trava community to submit proposals after a thorough review with discussion & feedback.
 * Security Advisory Board: The guardian for the protocol‚Äôs security when some malicious actions are aimed at the protocol or in unexpected events.
 * Governance Portal & Smart contracts: The autonomous ‚ÄúHand of the King‚Äù consists of governance contracts for on-chain voting and multiple timelocks governing and automating the changes & updates of Trava Ecosystem‚Äôs smart contracts. That keeps the governance process public and transparent to everyone.

Published in
4 min readMay 31, 2022
Share
 _Trava Finance is a decentralized, transparent, and secured lending marketplace that offers users a flexible mechanism to create and manage their lending pools to start a lending business._
_In May 2022, we have achieved some critical milestones in reaching our long-term goals. This article will bring you an_ _overview_ _of these achievements._
_Check out the two infographics below:_
Trava ecosystem in May 2022Trava ecosystem in May 2022
 
Trava Governance
Trava Governance module aims to bring the protocol to a new level of decentralization ‚Äî Trava DAO. This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes and improvements to participating in the protocols‚Äô decision-making process.
On May 19th, 2022, we officially launched the Trava Governance, the power now in the hand of the community. To prepare for this important event and to enrich this whole ecosystem, we implement essential features, including:
 
Trava Governance
Trava Governance module aims to bring the protocol to a new level of decentralization ‚Äî Trava DAO. This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes and improvements to participating in the protocols‚Äô decision-making process.
On May 19th, 2022, we officially launched the Trava Governance, the power now in the hand of the community. To prepare for this important event and to enrich this whole ecosystem, we implement essential features, including:

Trava Governance Vault
Trava Governance Vault is a practical feature used for determining the voting power and reward of users who lock TRAVA, rTRAVA, or LP TRAVA/BNB in this vault.
In fact, Trava Governance Vault offers flexible locking terms to provide multiple choices for users to choose from 1 week to 4 years. The more tokens they lock and the longer the locking period, the higher power they attain.
Enter app: https://app.trava.finance/governance/locker
 
Trava Governance
Trava Governance module aims to bring the protocol to a new level of decentralization ‚Äî Trava DAO. This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes and improvements to participating in the protocols‚Äô decision-making process.
On May 19th, 2022, we officially launched the Trava Governance, the power now in the hand of the community. To prepare for this important event and to enrich this whole ecosystem, we implement essential features, including:

Security Advisory Board
The Security Advisory Board (SAB) is established as a group of people in charge of protecting Trava Governance against potential insecurity: an attempt to manipulate the market by centralized factors, the effort to attack the protocol, etc.
At first, the SAB consists of 5 members from the Trava team and our advisor. However, the community members are welcome in the future, and Trava Governance will decide who is in this group.
Click here for more information.
 
Trava Governance
Trava Governance module aims to bring the protocol to a new level of decentralization ‚Äî Trava DAO. This module presents an on-chain governance mechanism, where the Trava community can propose and vote on protocol changes and improvements to participating in the protocols‚Äô decision-making process.
On May 19th, 2022, we officially launched the Trava Governance, the power now in the hand of the community. To prepare for this important event and to enrich this whole ecosystem, we implement essential features, including:

The Assembly of 12 Knights for the Trava Governance
12 Knights of the Trava Governance is determined as the Crown, the Wings, the Shield, the Eye, the Spear, the Sword, the Bow, the Cloak, the Helm, the Armor, the Gauntlet, and the Shadow. The Crown of the Twelve is held by King Svitanae, while the Wings had been appointed to Sir Kuana, Commander of TraDAO.
On May 26th, 2022, we introduced the first Heroine member of the Twelve assembly ‚Äî Dame Johanna, Shield of the Twelve. The other 9 Knights will be revealed shortly.
To recruit Johanna to your Knight Army: **CLICK HERE**
 
Data Analytics
In May 2022, two features related to data analytics were published, including Trava NFT Dashboard and the Trava Lending Monitoring module.
 * _Trava NFT Dashboard_ : a feature that helps users examine the statistics of Trava Knight NFT: The total volume, the number of new armoury sales, the Trava market cap, etc.


Enter app: https://nft-app.trava.finance/leaderboard/statistic
 * _Trava Lending monitoring module_ : An effective tool for ensuring clarity in the whole ecosystem and providing users with critical information affecting their investment decision.


Enter app: https://app.trava.finance/scoring/overview-analysis
 
Critical modification
With the TraDAO protocol, because of the implementation of TOD reputation, five new vaults relating to 5 different TOD reputation ranks were opened and replaced the previous single vault.
In addition, given the bear market, TraDAO has decided to stop buying back TOD from the market and use the Treasury in investment. Three main types of investment were considered, and the first one that will be used based on the community votes is investing in the Top Tokens.
Regarding Trava Knight NFT, the Heuristic Farming was opened. With this new mechanism, five current farming vaults will officially stop distributing TRAVA as a reward at 3 P.M UTC on May 15th. Instead, Trava provides five more vaults, and all of your Knights can participate in one or more vaults. Rewards from Heuristic Farming are rTRAVA tokens and EXP.
 
Partnership
Following the partnership announcement on 23th, May 2022, Trava Finance and TechFi have become partners and support each other in the field of technical support, business development, Marketing & communication development, and academic support."", ""image_ids"": [], ""filename"": null, ""url"": ""https://blog.trava.finance/monthly-recap-trava-ecosystem-in-may-2022-157ffb2b9959?source=collection_home_page----75e285c42203-----57-----------------------------------"", ""rrf_score"": 0.07142857142857142 }, { ""content"": ""**Mission & Vision**
DAO stands for ‚ÄúDecentralized Autonomous Organization‚Äù. Establishing the development of Trava DAO ensures Trava‚Äôs team mission:
 * A self-governed protocol, powered by the strength of the Trava community & secured smart contracts.
 * The growth of Trava Ecosystem, a decentralized finance platform with stable and outstanding products.


With that mission in mind, Trava DAO will be implemented & takes over centralized processes gradually with the growth of the ecosystem.
 

**Governance v1**
For version 1 of Trava Governance, we present evolution in governance processes with on-chain features enabled.
 

**Governance v1**
For version 1 of Trava Governance, we present evolution in governance processes with on-chain features enabled.

**Governance Process**
The governance process consists of 2 continuous processes: off-chain & on-chain.
 * Off-chain process:


In the off-chain process, anyone in the Trava community can raise their opinions and discuss ideas of how the protocol can improve by creating **TRC - Trava Request for Comments** on the Trava Forum.
After an idea is well-formed, a community member can follow our template for **TIP - Trava Improvement Proposal** and post on the forum for details feedback. We recommend off-chain voting (powered by snapshot.org) to gain exposure and rough consensus from the community to increase the chance of succeeding in the on-chain process.
When a TIP gets to its final version, the **DAO Committee** is in charge of the review process and officially proposes on-chain.
 * On-chain process:


When a TIP is proposed on-chain, it becomes transparent on the public blockchain; anyone possessing voting power can directly **vote for or against** this proposal.
After the voting period, a TIP will be **queued and executed** by the public.
The **Security Advisory Board acts as a guardian** to prevent malicious actions and security exploits in this process.
 

**Governance v1**
For version 1 of Trava Governance, we present evolution in governance processes with on-chain features enabled.

**Governance Authority**
In governance version 1, the DAO will have authority over the Trava lending protocol. The community will have to agree on any significant changes or updates through the on-chain process.
 

**Governance v1**
For version 1 of Trava Governance, we present evolution in governance processes with on-chain features enabled.

**Governance Power**
To gain governance power, holders need to lock their Trava or rTrava token in exchange for the veTRAVA token, which holds voting power. This vote locking mechanism encourages users who show a solid commitment to the protocol with more governance power and incentive.
